description:
This is a sequel to the first Farland Story game. After Arc and his friends have defeated the evil Demon King, the brave knight was chosen to be the next king, and the lovely priestess Ferio agreed to be his wife. On the day of coronation, Arc and his little sister recall the events of the grand battle, when suddenly they hear a noise from the shrine with the Hole Sword. When they rush there, they find out the sword was taken away by demons. So, was the Demon King not defeated by Arc after all?

The game looks very similarly to its predecessor. The entire gameplay is dedicated to strategic battles, during which you navigate your large party in turn-based mode over the world map. Once you have issued commands to all your party members, it's the enemies' turn to act. You can attack enemies when they are in range of your weapon, or cast healing and offensive area spells. Your characters level up, can use items, and equip a variety of weapons and armor pieces.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can select your favorite music from the game

title: Farland Story Denki: Arc Ō no Ensei

description:
"Tenshi no Namida" is a sequel to Farland Story Denki: Arc Ou no Ensei. One day the queen Ferio finds an unconscious young girl near the castle. The girl has lost her memory. In a terrible nightmare, she hears the voice of a demon lord, calling her "Fana". Beside this name, she cannot remember anything. Ferio asks her husband, the king Arc, to take Fana to a nearby city and to visit the archbishop, who might know more about Fana's past. The two are unaware of the grave dangers which await them because of this decision...

The third in the row of Farland Story games, "Tenshi no Namida" looks and plays very similarly to the first two games. You navigate your party over the world map in turn-based fashion. After you have assigned commands to your party members, it is the enemies' turn. You can attack physically when enemies are in range of your weapon, or cast spells - each character in your party belongs to a certain class and specializes in different type of combat. You gain experience points directly from hitting an enemy, even while counter-attacking, and can therefore level up in the middle of a battle.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hey, how come is Arc always level 1?! Didn't he defeat all possible enemies in the previous games?
Fana, one of the main characters of the game

title: Farland Story: Tenshi no Namida

description:
Chronologically the fourth Farland Story game, "Shirogane no Tsubasa" makes a fresh start story-wise, bring the first Farland Story not to deal with the hero Arc and his friends. In this game, you follow the destiny of a rebel group, who had to flee from the evil despot Pepper. Led by the cat-man Darland and the fugitive Phir, the rebels must overcome all possible obstacles in order to put an end to the evil reign and to restore peace in the land.

Although the game has a different story, it still looks and plays more or less the same way as the first three Farland Story games. The game consists of strategic battles, during which you navigate your party members in turn-based mode over the map, attacking enemies when they are in range, and casting spells. Various type of terrain influences your attacks. For example, if you position your character on a square with a castle, his/her HP will be healed.
title: Farland Story: Shirogane no Tsubasa

description:
This Farland Story game (chronologically the fifth in the main series) tells a story which is not directly connected to the adventures of Arc and his friends (told in the first three games). In this game, you control Kushna, the 17-year-old princess of Sardis. Two important people wish to marry her: the young Shacliff, prince of the neighbor kingdom Rulphan, and the count Geruda. However, the princess feels she is too young to marry anybody, and escapes the castle, dreaming to find a quiet place where she could practice martial arts. The situation changes somewhat when she accidentally meets prince Shacliff himself and discovers he is in fact quite a nice fellow. And meanwhile, horde of monsters invaded the castle, and there are rumors about a rebellion...

Although it has a completely different story line, this Farland Story game plays and feels exactly like its predecessors. Once again, you control a party which you can freely move on the battle terrain in turn-based mode. You first assign commands to all your party members, and then wait while the enemies execute their turns. Both you and the enemy automatically counter-attack whenever the attacker is also within the weapon's range. You gain experience points needed for leveling up directly after each attack.
title: Farland Story: Daichi no Kizuna

description:
The sixth in the row on Farland Story games, "Kamigami no Isen" is set in a different world than the rest: a retro-style, Western-like environment with elements of sci-fi. You control a thief named Grey, who one day gets caught "in flagrante", and is saved by a girl named Elicia. It seems that Elicia and her sister have to escape the house, persecuted by enemies. Grey decides to help the sister, and gets involved in a conspiracy he would never dream about.

Despite having a totally different story and setting, this Farland Story game still looks and plays more or less exactly the same as its predecessors. You have a party which you navigate on the screen in turn-based mode, assigning commands to it (such as "Move", "Heal", etc.) Some characters have special commands (like "Sneak" for Grey). Whenever you and the enemy attack each other, a short animated attack sequence is shown. You can use various types of terrain to your advantage (different for each character type). As in previous Farland Story games, you gain experience points directly after performing any action in a battle.

sample_screenshots.caption: The hero and his... ahem... dubious activities

title: Farland Story: Kamigami no Isan

description:
Long time ago, seven gods who were guarding the Earth defeated the evil god Gadim. But time has passed, and the seven benevolent gods have vanished one by one. Evil has awaken from its slumber. It's time for somebody else - a human - to become a hero and to defeat it once and for all. This chosen one is a young girl named Thiria Fray. She must find other girls with supernatural powers to aid her on her quest to defeat the evil.

Filsnown plays like a standard top-down Japanese RPG: the party of heroines roams the world map, descend into dungeons, fight random enemies in first-person perspective combat using regular attacks or magic, and visit towns and villages to buy supplies and to rest. It contains cut-scenes with nudity and explicit sexual situations.

sample_screenshots.caption: Intro: the war between good and bad gods
Those guys are cute! I don't want to kill them...
Talking to the king in the throne room
Battle in a forest, with beautiful backgrounds

title: Filsnown: Hikari to Toki

description:
The first entry in the Dragon Master Silk series, Ryū Shōkan Musume has a very simple plot: a girl named Silk is chosen by the Dragon King to be the Dragon Master, controlling the powers of three elemental dragons: fire, water, and earth. Aided by these three dragons (who look like cute young girls and are called Aka, Ao, and Ki, which means, respectively, "red", "blue", and "yellow" in Japanese), Silk has to venture into a magical dungeon and to defeat the evil lurking inside.

The game is a dungeon crawler with pseudo-3D graphics, random enemy encounters, and turn-based combat. The player has control over the party of four girls, who have different characteristics in physical strength and magic casting.

There is some mild erotic content (innuendos and skimpy clothing), but no explicit nudity or sexual situations.

sample_screenshots.caption: Silk is scared of the Dragon King, and that's the result
For some reason she lives in a dungeon and sells items. To whom? Red crabs?

title: Dragon Master Silk: Ryū Shōkan Musume

description:
The hero of this game, named Zenith, has borrowed too much money. The village inhabitants just beat him up, but the village elder has other plans. It appears that several young girls have been missing lately. As a punishment, Zenith must venture to the nearby tower, infested by all kinds of monsters and demons, and see if he could find the girls there.

Gaias Lord is an action game with a lot of environmental puzzles, most of which involves pushing crates to clear the way through the top-down dungeon, accessing treasure chests, keys, and other important items. There are also enemies wandering around the tower, whom Zenith can fight in real-time combat, using his sword or special techniques. There are slight RPG elements, as Zenith can equip various weapons and armors scattered through the dungeon.

The game has anime-style cut scenes, some of which feature nudity and sexual situations.

sample_screenshots.caption: You know, I've always been a cat person

title: Gaias Lord

description:
The hero of this game (whom the player must name at the beginning) is much more interested in pretty girls than in ancient prophecies and religious rituals. However, once he finds out that his sweetheart Adiana is a descendant of an ancient god, and that young men of the village participate in a dangerous ritual in order to be chosen as her husband, the hero decides he must act. Little does he know that this would just be the beginning of a long adventure, involving all this stuff he is not interested in... plus lots of pretty girls!

Jinn: Eternal Hero is a Japanese-style RPG with randomly appearing enemies and turn-based combat, with an unusual (for Japanese RPGs) perspective: the entire game uses first-person view, including town and dungeon navigation, similarly to Bard's Tale games, in pseudo-3D environment. The game has several cutscenes that include nudity and sexual situation.

sample_screenshots.caption: The party fights a skeleton boss
This guy is not very friendly
The hero of this game surely knows how to have a good time :)

title: Jinn: Eternal Hero

description:
Long time ago, human beings believed in gods. But time has passed, and the humans stopped worshipping them. The gods got angry. The world plunged into chaos. Demons who looked like pretty girls have appeared, driving people insane. Five kings have sent brave heroes to find a magical stone that alone could restore peace to the world. One of these heroes is Lucido. Aided by a simple village girl, he bravely descends into a dungeon full of seductive monsters - but he should beware of the competition...

Themm plays very similarly to Raidy games: it is one big first-person dungeon crawl (solo) with randomly appearing enemies and turn-based combat. The enemies are, as the story implies, pretty and female; they disrobe upon defeat, which would already qualify this game for the adult genre, even if it weren't for the boss enemies who engage in full-fledged sexual activity with the hero.

sample_screenshots.caption: Your only friend in this hostile world...
...as long as she has her clothes on

title: Themm: Haruka Naru Meikyū

description:
No, this game has nothing to do with Harlem (the title is a misspelling of harem by the Japanese developers), but rather with ancient China. Basically, it makes fun of some of the most venerable Chinese myths, presenting legendary pseudo-historical characters in a comical and obscene way. The story begins as a young warrior named Li is playing "peeping Tom" with the goddess/empress Xiwangmu, the Queen-Mother of West. Enraged by Li's actions, the old court magician Taishang Laojun casts a spell on him, turning him into a woman. Now the poor guy has to find a way to reverse to his true macho self - but not before he defeats the best female warriors of the country in combat...

Tōgenkyō is an adventure game with strategic battles. The player navigates Li through the top-down world; dialogues are displayed as still shots with menu choices, viewed from first-person perspective, typically for Japanese adventures. At certain points Li will have to fight other girls. The battles are turn-based. Both Li and the enemy character are dealt a deck of cards. The player has to choose a card (attacking, healing, etc.) for the attack move, and click on a rapidly spinning additional card to enhance the attack - or make it fail. During the enemy turn, the player also must click on a card, with different results.

The game features a lot of explicit sexual situations, some of which are quite "hardcore".

sample_screenshots.caption: Chinese guys are discussing Xiwangmu's naked body. No, really!
The battles end with a climax!! :-)

title: Tōgenkyō: Harlem Fantasy

description:
In the year 199X, a huge meteorite collided with the Earth. The consequences exceeded every disaster seen before. Even long after the collision, due to the distortion of gravity, volcano eruptions, earthquakes, and other disasters continued to occur. Civilization has shrunk into small cities spread across vast wasteland. The level of violence has raised beyond the imaginable.

In such a terrible world, the 18-year-old musician named Damian has to earn his living by playing piano in a bar in the city of Gunu. One day, something falls on the Earth right in front of him - this "something" being a girl named Nicole, who apparently arrived from the mysterious meteorite. The first task assigned to the hero, if you haven't guessed it, is to get Nicole some clothes. Naturally, this soon develops into a much more sinister story musicians usually don't get involved into...

Half-Pipe differs from traditional Japanese RPGs in several aspects. Even though there is a party (up to four people), during combat the player has to choose one character at a time. Most of the battles are random, but there are many that can be triggered by talking to a character. The battles are turn-based and are viewed from first-person perspective. Damian is controlled by the player, while the other three (all girls) are controlled by the AI. Only when Damian's HP reaches zero, the game is over. Damian can use a variety of attacks (punches, kicks, etc.). There are no weapons or armor in the game. Even though there is an overworld map heroes can travel on, much of the action happen in the large cities, which take time to explore.

Female characters disrobe when defeated in combat, and there are plot-related cutscenes with explicit sexual situations.

sample_screenshots.caption: That's a somewhat more original female character. She has attitude, indeed...

As the palette-swapping mid- to high-level enemy appears, I attack him with a... cigarette. This is the only (!) weapon in the game, and it's so powerful that you won't ever need to use any other move
Damian punches and kicks a low-level world map enemy
Wow, this is a cool hotel! Five stars?

title: Half-Pipe

description:
Long time ago, a legendary hero defeated an evil dragon. He wore a magical bracelet that protected him during the battle. years passed, and the memories of his heroic deeds, even his name, have faded away from people's minds. But a young girl named Rouge, who trains regularly in the art of sword-fighting, still dreams about a real hero - more precisely, imagines that she will marry one.

One day Rouge was reading a newspaper in her house in the quiet village of Milfa. The news were not very good: monsters have infested the land, and the Demon King Zaba seems to have some particularly sinister plans. Rouge is determined to stop the demonic plans, but first she has to prove herself as a fighter, so she ventures to the big city where a tournament takes place...

Legend of Rouge is an adult role-playing game. The entire game is played from first-person perspective. Navigation in towns and dungeons is done in pseudo-3D environments. Enemy encounters are random, and the battles are turn-based. Rouge and her party members can use special attacks and magic, which require MP. Some gameplay segments use standard Japanese adventure interface, with menu choices over 2D anime-style backgrounds.

sample_screenshots.caption: Staying at an inn. Rouge is ready to go to bed... Alone... *sniff*
The complete party takes on some enemies in the Sea Palace dungeon
Rouge, Parfait, and Sem are preparing to take a bath together... and they will!
The first meeting with the eccentric magician Sem

title: Rouge no Densetsu - Legend of Rouge

description:
In Escape, the player assumes the role of an ordinary teenager named Root. He is returning from a long journey, and just beyond the mountain, he can see his house. But fate had other plans for the boy: one step on the wrong stone, and Root falls through a dark pit into the underground world. Looks like it won't be simple for him to find the way home, because this world is populated by girls, each one of which wants something from him...

Escape is an adventure game in Japanese style: it has no real puzzles, and has to be solved mainly by talking to different characters and taking some decisions. Unlike many other Japanese adventures, "Escape" is viewed from top-down perspective and allows the player character to walk around and to explore the rather large, sometimes maze-like locations. There are also different endings in the game, depending on the player's choices during it. The game contains explicit sex scenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Leaving the cave, returning home. Haven't solved almost anything. One of the bad, incomplete endings
I certainly do like the way you treat foreign guests here
Looks like there is some sort of civilization here

title: Escape!

description:
Two thousand years ago, a great hero has defeated the demon lord Gargantua, with the help of a magical sword and a young sorceress. Time has passed, and the sword was inherited by the descendants of the hero. The two last ones are brothers, named Cain and Abel. While Abel has proved himself as a great warrior, Cain prefers to stay in his home village and chase pretty girls. But one day, he has a strange dream. A woman who calls herself the Goddess of Time appears and tells him that Gargantua is about to be revived. Cain first tries to ignore the dream, but soon a series of strange events convinces him that the time has come to prove himself a hero.

Harlem Blade is a rather traditional Japanese RPG with top-down navigation (can be done with arrow keys or in a point-and-click fashion with the mouse) and a world-map with linear routes. Enemies appear randomly, with battle screens superimposed on exploration backgrounds. It is possible to speed up the battles by setting them on Auto. Characters level up, buy equipment, use magic and items, and otherwise follow standard Japanese RPG procedures, with the addition of scenes that contain nudity.
title: Harlem Blade: The Greatest of All Time

description:
The hero of the game is a seemingly ordinary man named Kaneda Momezo. But in fact he is not an ordinary man at all, but a superhero called "Mokkoriman", a name which is derived from the Japanese word for the "splash!" sound usually associated with sex. Young girls have been kidnapped and turned into seductive, but deadly monsters, who kill people with lethal attacks called SEX. It's time for the Mokkoriman to show his true face! With the help of his two superhero-aiding pretty girls, Mokkoriman is out for justice, revenge, and mutual SEX.

Mokkoriman RPG mostly plays like a traditional top-down Japanese RPG, with world map, random turn-based battles, party management, levels, equipment, and everything else, albeit with a definite comedic undertone: the enemies are naked girls, regular attacks are called "sex" (with choices of one-on-one or group), instead of magic there is "dirty talk", and health is restored by reading Japanese porn magazines.

The game is very heavy on explicit sexual content; even during regular battles the attacks are animated in a very suggestive way. The game marks the beginning of Illusion's career as the maker of interactive sex scenes. The sexual encounters in Mokkoriman RPG have their own gameplay, which involves manipulating the mouse to simulate the movements of the player character during intimate moments. Some of the sex scenes are animated, making the game a RPG pioneer in this field.

sample_screenshots.caption: Attack in progress. Regular attacks are called "SEX" in this game
Battle! Note the funny arena-like battle screen
The hero in his non-superhero form, with his girlfriend

title: Mokkoriman RPG

description:
Once upon a time, there was harmony and balance in the world. Four kingdoms of humans have watched over the four elements. But then a traitor appeared, who has angered the Goddess with his selfish deeds. The balance was destroyed, the elements were no more in harmony, and the world plunged into chaos...

Twelve thousand years later, a young knight named Eagle Windeed has been having a strange dream. Maybe there is still salvation for the human race. Maybe it is still possible to make peace with the higher beings. Eagle arrives at a tavern near the Tree Dungeon, determined to find out what his dream meant...

Mime is a dungeon crawler: the entire game is set in a maze-like dungeon environments (with auto-map). There are no "safe" areas; random enemies can pop out anywhere (the random encounter rate is however quite low). Eagle starts alone, but later in the game three other heroes join him. The battles are turn-based, utilizing the standard "attack/magic" formula. There are a few explicit sex scenes in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Interesting character creation... what will you speak with the cat about?

title: Mime

description:
Trouble is in the kingdom of Stellar. The lovely princess has disappeared, and the king sends his best men to investigate. All they find on the spot where the princess has vanished is a confused young boy who has lost his memory and knows only his name: Liann. Since he still might have some connection to the princess' disappearance, the king sends Liann on a quest to find her. And perhaps along the way, the boy will be able to find the magic flower called Amaranth, that restores people's memories...

Amaranth is a RPG with action-based combat. Enemies appear randomly, and Liann and his party members are taken to a separate battle screen. Attacks are performed by bumping into enemies, like in Ys series. The other party members are controlled by the AI. Equipment and items can be bought in town shops, and the heroes level up in a standard RPG fashion.

sample_screenshots.caption: Princesses, other noble ladies... oh my!

title: Amaranth

description:
Years have passed since the great hero Liann Fremdes defeated the evil Bosedorf and brought peace to the kingdom of Stellar, opening a new chapter in its glorious history. Liann has retired since then, hoping to have some peace for himself. But once a hero, always a hero: an aggressive nation from the West threatens the country, and help is needed. Liann arrives at the city of Strahl to talk to the local king, and hooks up with an elf girl named Din who is willing to accompany the hero on his travels...

Amaranth II is the second in the series of action-based RPGs. The party roams the world in top-down fashion, levels up and buys equipment, just like in the first game. Attacks are performed by bumping into enemies, who can be seen on the screen before either the player or the enemy initiate combat.

sample_screenshots.caption: Recalling events from before. Poor princess! Those men...
Events from the first game: fighting Bosedorf
Nothing like misspelled and gramatically wrong German...

title: Amaranth II

description:
The first creation of Illusion, a company famous for its adult games, was a turn-based war game - with the only factor hinting at its creator's libido-flattering future being the generals of the game - all pretty girls, all from different countries.

There are three modes in the game: player vs. computer, in which the player selects any general of any country; campaign mode, in which the player progresses stage-by-stage, beginning with Japan; and two-player mode, in which the players can choose any stage from the beginning.

The gameplay itself is rather complex; as the general, the player has to protect his cities and at the same time send his army to combat the invading opponent. There is a wide variety of different units, including jets, helicopters, tanks, etc. Whenever a unit approaches an enemy unit, it can perform an attack, assuming that its weapons remain in range. Attacks are displayed as separate screens, graphically displaying the results. The player can choose to give up when it is clear that there are no chances for victory. Either way, a successful invasion of the opponent results in Game Over.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is hilarious. The Russian girl is called "Misha"... but it's a guy's name!!
Unbelievable. The German girl actually wears a Nazi uniform

title: Angel Army

description:
After the Earth became devastated by pollution and other disasters, humans started building space colonies. The majority of human beings were born in space since then. But their health was much worse than the health of average human being born on the Earth before. Scientists have developed a unique technology on the second oldest space colony, named T2 (oddly enough, just like the Japanese company who made this game). But something went terribly wrong, and soon the scientists realized that they were killing human beings with the new technology. The project leader was killed, and a man named Nakajima took the power into his own hands, intending to continue the experiment for his own destructive purposes. One of the scientists contacted then a young female hunter, a special agent trained in armed combat, to help him track down the bad guys and to stop the experiment.

Binyu Hunter is a shooter in which the player controls the young heroine, her back always turned to the player, moving her horizontally, shooting enemies with the left mouse button and reloading with the right. Double-tapping left and right arrow keys results in the heroine diving and jumping to the side. There is a variety of enemies to deal with, from stationary regular soldiers to snipers, grenade-tossing enemies, enemies with protective shields, bosses with special techniques, etc. Each stage typically consists of many enemy waves coming in different patterns and with increasing difficulty.

The story of the game is told through anime-style cut scenes. Once a shooting stage is over, the player is taken to a separate screen that allows him to choose a picture of a pretty girl, usually absolutely unrelated to the plot. Pictures of those girls appear on the screen, with less and less clothes, and the player can scroll, aim with the mouse, and capture a "photo" of the girl, which will then be saved in the gallery (accessible from the main menu).
title: Binyu Hunter

description:
The year is 1928. The First World War has devastated the world. But life goes on, and people try to forget the horror of wars. The hero of the game is a simple, young Japanese man named Koshino. He is a member of the crew of a huge ship that carries on board prominent people from different countries. It sails from Japan to America, via the Mediterranean Sea. Before long the hero gets acquainted with the passengers of the ship - all from different countries, most of them pretty young girls, and some of them having their own hidden agenda. Meeting suspicious people on the ship brings Koshino to conclusion that something will go very wrong - unless he interferes and investigates, at the same time trying to seduce as many young foreign ladies as possible.

Blind Games plays like a typical Japanese adventure. Most of the gameplay involves going around the ship (actually jumping from screen to screen by choosing the "Move" command in the menu), bumping into people and triggering events. The standard interaction are menu verbs Move, Look, and Think; however, many scenes have context-sensitive commands and dialogue choices, that lead to branching story-line - mostly involving which girl Koshino will have sex with and which he will leave in peace.

sample_screenshots.caption: A typical corridor. They all look the same. Nice colors, though
Hi there, Lewton. I think you are in the wrong <moby game="Discworld Noir"> Discword Noir</moby> game!

title: Blind Games

description:
The Guild Master and the Protectors of the Elements had the best intentions. All they wanted was to use the Grand Card in order to summon the Grand Master who would protect the world, just like the legends said. Surely they could not predict would would happen. That the Grand Master would be a sexy, but decidedly unfriendly girl. That she would quickly realize that she wields the power over all Elves. That she would kill all the Protectors. And that she would swear to destroy humanity...

Only one person can stop the Grand Master. A simple young human boy named Nemo, but with mysterious ties to the race of Elves. When his father is killed by the Grand Master's minions, he knows that it's not just about saving humanity - it gets personal!...

Elemental Ō ("Elemental King") is an RPG with several distinct features. For once, there are no random or regular battles - Nemo can freely roam the vast overworld map without fear of being attacked. Navigation is done in top-down fashion, while battles are viewed from first-person perspective. The pre-set battles (mostly against female elves) take place on a separate screen, and utilize a card system. Nemo can buy (or acquire from treasure chests or from other characters) cards, which stand for weapons, armor, magical spells, and items usually used in RPGs. Cards have their own elemental properties, so when choosing cards in battle, the player should pay close attention to the elements of the opponent's cards. It is also possible to fuse two or more cards into a more powerful one by using special cards.

The game is controlled entirely with the mouse. Like many other Japanese DOS games, Elemental Ō contains nudity and sexual situations.

sample_screenshots.caption: Battle against a maniacal shotgun-wielding elf
The Grand Master appears...  Don't let her... erm... sex-appeal fool you. She is evil!

title: Elemental Ō

description:
The story of Harenochi Munasawagi does not start in a very original way: the protagonist is a high-school boy named Kazuhiko, who is - surprise! - permanently horny, displaying his "affections" at any given opportunity to anyone young and female, including even his childhood friend Chihiro. But while the focus on the story is on Kazuhiko and his quest for physical intimacy (which often results in girls getting angry and beating him up), there are other rather disturbing elements that come into play later - in particular, bunny-like demons who share Kazuhiko's passion for the opposite sex...

The game is a typical Japanese adventure gameplay-wise, with the interaction consisting of choosing verb commands from a menu, often needing to deplete all the options before being able to proceed. There is also navigation on the map of the town and the high school (menu-based). Most of the commands are of "Look" and "Talk" variety, but they get much more specific when it comes to Kazuhiko "interacting" with the girls. There is no point-and-click interface even there, though; the entire game is played by choosing menu commands.

sample_screenshots.caption: Of course, the school uniform just makes her sexier, right?
She looks tired... should we help her?

title: Harenochi Munasawagi

description:
In this dark age, human live under the rule of a mighty government that possesses PSYCO - a brain-washing technology that would instantly turn anyone into their willing slave. One day a young boy named Kazuya encounters Henry, a robotic leader of a resistance group that tries to overthrow the rulers. The problem is that these resistance fighters - all of them young pretty girls - have been brain-washed by PSYCO. There is only one way. Kazuya and Henry must defeat them in battle, and then Kazuya must have sex with them. That, and only that, will stop the evil influence of PSYCO. Kazuya bravely agrees. The sacrifices we are willing to make for our country's sake...

Horny Sweeper is a turn-based strategy game. The player begins the game with Kazuya and Henry alone, but afterwards more and more girls join the party after having been... erm... treated by Kazuya's wondrous psyche-restoring skills. Most of the battles are against government parties, which consist of various character classes (soldiers, mages, robots, etc.). The player's party also acquires different talents over the course of the game: a healer, a shotgun-wielding character, etc. When characters attack each other, an animated sequence is displayed.

Several stages are dedicated to defeating future female companions. Afterwards, the game switches to sex scenes, some of which have point-and-click interface and require specific actions from the player, while others utilize simple command-based menus. Some of the sex scenes are animated.

sample_screenshots.caption: Whatever this guy is, he'll have to taste some shotgun shells!
You are tired, baby, I understand. I've already been though this... :)

title: Horny Sweeper: Kōshoku Shikakenin

description:
The sequel to Kōshoku Shikakenin tells us what happened to the brave hero Kazuya after he has overthrown the evil regime in the first game (and have had sex with many women on the way). One day Kazuya goes outside, enjoying the good weather, when an unknown girl appears and says she is the sister of Mai, one of the heroines of the first game. It looks like PSYCO, the evil brain-washing power, is back! And not just anywhere, but in a girls high school! Kazuya readily agrees to liberate the poor girls from the curse of PSYCO - probably because he knows too well that the only way to do it is by having sex with the afflicted girl...

Horny Sweeper 2: Joshikō Kiki Ippatsu plays very similarly to the first game. It is a top-down turn-based strategy game in which the player navigates Kazuya and the... ahem!.. liberated girls on the large battle fields and attacks when enemies are in range. The difference is that in the sequel, characters gain experience points from each attack, rather than automatically leveling up after large battles, which grants this game a definite role-playing angle. There are more girls (including old acquaintances from the first game) and more attacks to choose from - but the hentai scenes are not interactive this time.

sample_screenshots.caption: A girl alone in the park, at night... is she under the influence of PSYCO?
...so Kazuya helps her :) Altruism at its best. This scene is animated, by the way
Here the goal is to infiltrate the school

title: Horny Sweeper 2: Joshikō Kiki Ippatsu

description:
The third scenario of Immoral Study describes yet another somewhat unusual teaching experience in the life of Mr. Hitosuji, a young and handsome private tutor. This time, the victim... err... pupil is Asakura Manami, a shy, quiet girl who lives together with her mother. Hitosuji is supposed to make Manami a better student - but instead he chooses to participate in S&M relationship between mother and daughter...

The third part has the same gameplay as the two previous titles - meaning hardly no gameplay at all. The game is completely linear, there is only one way from start to finish, and the only interaction consists of repeatedly choosing menu options until an event is triggered. Like its two predecessors, Scenario 3 also contains animated scenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...and then offers her something thicker than a pencil, as he says...
While the daughter is tied up, the mother has sex with the protagonist
The teacher asks her to draw on him...
She is being tortured, but she enjoys it... what a crazy place
Events from the previous two games

title: Immoral Study Scenario 3: Asakura Manami

description:
The year is 2197. In order to be able to compete with the leading powers of the world, Japan was urbanized, huge city areas covering the entire country. In these huge, soulless cities, crime thrives. Violence is part of everyday life. Female police agents Sagoto, Kikuno, and Chisame are sent to Koube City to arrest drug dealers. But all goes wrong in the very beginning, and the young women fall victims to vicious criminals.

Kankin has none of the classic (since Mokkoriman RPG) Illusion gameplay elements, and is low on interactivity even compared to other Japanese adventures. The player's input is reduced to choosing available menu options. Wrong choices may sometimes lead to Game Over, but most of the time the player has to go through all the options several times to make the story advance. There is no character movement whatsoever in the game, and the characters from whose point of view the story is told change with each scene, and include other minor characters beside the three main heroines.

"Kankin" shares its dark futuristic setting and several characters (such as Kikuno and others) with other Illusion games, in particular its follow-up Requiem Hurts: Kankin.

sample_screenshots.caption: More new characters, more rape scenes... Come on guys...
Sagoto is thinking. Maybe she thinks displaying her underwear helps
These choices actually mean something. Game Over is just around the corner
Kikuno has to fight, but how?

title: Kankin

description:
Sei Senshi Mokkoriman opens the line of Mokkoriman games. Mokkoriman is a super-hero. Perhaps a little unusual one. You see, Mokkoriman is famous for his... how should I say that... manly powers. That's why he is called "sei senshi", which means sex warrior. Mokkoriman is determined to make women happy (or so he thinks) by having sex with them. But the path to each beautiful woman is filled with dangerous creatures and traps. Death awaits our hero at every corner, so he must prove that his other super-powers - jumping and shooting - will be as effective as his main talent...

An early game by Illusion, "Sei Senshi Mokkoriman" marks the beginning of this company's long tradition of fusing mainstream game genres with sex scenes. This particular game experiments with platform genre. It is a full-fledged platformer with complex levels that have to be solved in a unique way: there are teleporters that connect various areas of the level, and Mokkoriman can use them only if he has gathered enough energy - which he does when defeating enemies. If his energy count is too low, he should return and fight more enemies (which respawn on each screen). Mokkoriman has no melee attack: he shoots small energy balls at enemies. Various upgrades can be found, which enhance Mokkoriman's shooting abilities, making him shoot two or more balls. Rather than instantly dying when hit by an enemy, Mokkoriman has a proper health bar. Health packs are also scattered around.

Each level ends with a sex scene between the hero and the "boss girl" of the level. Trademark interactive sex scenes make their first appearance in this game, though in a rather basic form: the player has to hold a mouse button and quickly drag the mouse, imitating Mokkoriman's movements on screen. The goal is to fill the girl's "pleasure meter", while not running out of "spirit", as the game calls it (read: premature ejaculation is not an option!).

sample_screenshots.caption: Interactive sex gameplay! Hold the right mouse button and drag the mouse to imitate... err... movements; click the left button to change positions! And they say games have no educational value :)

title: Sei Senshi Mokkoriman

description:
The third Mokkoriman game is perhaps Illusion's most unusual genre experiment: a fishing game with sex. No, there is no sex with fish in this game. Instead, the super-hero Mokkoriman (his super-power being his unparalleled ability to sexually satisfy women) and his two female side-kicks that were fighting together with him in Mokkoriman RPG, Oppain and Futomomon, have to fish (literally) women out of pools, bath tubs, etc. The player can choose to control either of the three, even though it doesn't affect the gameplay. It is possible to choose one of the seven available stages (each with a different woman) right from the beginning, with the eighth stage ("office lady") hidden. The fishing simulation part consists of two parts, both fairly simple. The entire game is controlled with the left mouse button. First, the player has to click at the right time when the hook is deep in the water. Then the woman will be pulled out of the water, caught by a part of her clothes. The player is taken to a new screen, which requires him to press and hold the mouse button, releasing it at the right moment and then pressing again, to successfully pull up the woman.

What follows next is a regular point-and-click sex simulation (no Illusion-style real-time mouse movement), which involves clicking on the woman's different body parts to make her enjoy. Afterwards, the player is taken back to the pool. Each level has three different series of pictures depicting the player's "fishing" activities. They appear randomly, and the level can be considered completed when the player has unlocked all three.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fishing in a bath tub? What next - shooting fish in a barrel?..

title: Mokkoriman Series: Rankō Nyotai Tsuri - Mokkoriman no Nani de Nushi Tsuri

description:
A young man wakes up and sees a young woman in front of him. She tells him that her name is Crith, and she is the village nurse. The young man tells her that his name is Graffy, and... but that's all he can remember. Just his name, and the name of his cute strange pet animal - Lippen. Crith says that he was found unconscious outside of the village. Graffy is naturally eager to restore his memory, but there is more pressing business: it appears that the gods are angry at the villagers, and demand a human sacrifice, which has to be Crith. Graffy is determined to protect the girl, but there is only one way: to descend into the gods' temples and to find out why they are angry...

Mug-R is a first-person dungeon crawler, the gameplay focusing on exploring and mapping (with an automap) the maze-like temples. The party of playable characters - Graffy, Crith, and Lippen - fight randomly appearing enemies in turn-based combat. they gain experience points and level up in standard RPG fashion. Other RPG elements are somewhat reduced: there are no magic spells at all, and item usage is limited. The game contains explicit sexual scenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Boss battle. Note the enemy HP bar
Crith... before we discuss anything further... could you please wear a bra?
being fully aware of the fact that screenshots require descriptions, I proudly typed: "This is a door"

title: Mug-R

description:
Mr. M (whom true fans of Illusion games will certainly recognize as the one and the only Mokkoriman) is an alien who looks like a human being. Since he is a super-hero, his main concern is to save people - most importantly, women. For Mr. M, "saving" is synonymous with "sexually satisfying". There are beautiful women on remote planets that have not experienced the joy of true sexual satisfaction. Only one man can save them - Mr. M's friend, the famous Space Gigolo, Red Cobra, the one who "lives and dies for love and justice"! And he has just the right tool - an intelligent sex toy named Pakki! But alas, not all is simple: the sexy, but deadly intergalactic warrior Mangoose and her minions will do everything possible to stop Red Cobra! Be vigilant, hero!

Usually just called Red Cobra, this game is yet another Illusion-made genre experiment. This time, we are talking about space shooter with sex. The player controls Red Cobra's spaceship in a pseudo-3D scrolling environment. The gameplay is what one would expect from a space shooter: shoot everything, avoid enemy blows, grab the power-ups, beat a boss, finish the stage. Everything is controlled with the mouse: moving it moves the ship on screen, holding the left button fires at enemies. There are three selectable difficulty levels.

The game also has extensive, story-heavy cut-scenes between the shooting levels, with plenty of dialogue and - naturally - sex scenes. The sex scenes in this game are quite mild (especially for Illusion) and mostly involve women "rescued" by Red Cobra using the sex toy Pakki for... well, what sex toys are usually used for. Some of these scenes are animated.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first girl who needs to be... errm... saved
Boss battle! Against two scantily clad athletic girls!

title: Ai no Omochashi: Space Gigolo - Red Cobra

description:
The protagonist of the game is an ordinary Japanese man who lives together with his pretty wife Harunako. Two years after their marriage, they decided to move into a mansion in the suburbs. Everything seems normal when the couple arrives. But very quickly they both become involved in sexual intrigues, and witness strange events - mostly of sexual nature - that occur in the presence of their neighbors. Looks like the quiet family life they were hoping for will never become reality...

Ura Mansion Hakkin is an adventure game with very limited interaction, which mostly plays like "choose-your-adventure" book. The protagonist is automatically taken to different locations and through the story; however, many scenes offer the possibility to make a choice, selecting a corresponding command from the menu. Some of these choices just involve choosing different ways of sexual intercourse, while others propel the story into a different direction. The game is very heavy on explicit sexual content, the majority of its scenes being depictions of sexual encounters the hero witnesses or participates in.

sample_screenshots.caption: Oh no! The husband is back!!

title: Ura Mansion Hakkin

description:
An ordinary Japanese high-school student named Hatsumi Tarou was having a normal life - preparing for examinations, like all his classmates - when one day everything changed: it was on the day when he saw a talking cat. The cat promptly explained that it was not a cat, but a creature from the Magic World. Once in a thousand or so years, a fighting competition is being held between the best female fighters of the Magic World. The winner becomes the next queen. The referee however should be a human being; and this time, the honor belongs to our friend Tarou!

Valkyrie: The Power Beauties is a fighting game. The "fight mode" allows the player to fight against any of the opponents (controlled by AI or the second player). The "story mode" is single-player only. It has cut-scenes and dialogues between the fights, which are dictated by the story events. Tarou is helping one of the girls to defeat all the opponents one by one. The fights take place in different locations, but follow the same structure: win two rounds and advance to the next stage. The opponents (all female) have each a distinct fighting style, including some long-ranged attacks and magical spells. It is possible to jump, punch, kick from different positions (also crouching), grapple the opponent, or use special techniques.

After the fight is won, the defeated girl asks the "referee" to have sex with her. The sex scenes mostly consist of two or more pictures of the girls. Some scenes allow the player to choose what to do, but overall the interaction is minimal.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the omake mode, you can view all the sex scenes
Oh wow, the power feels good...

title: Valkyrie: The Power Beauties

description:
After the six girls of the Jahana group have concluded their Variable Geo tournament, a girl named Kotoe Kashima, who happens to be the childhood rival of Reimi Jahana, has organized a new tournament, called "Bout of Cabalistic Goddess". The tournament is once again sponsored by a chain of restaurants, with famous martial artists working there as waitresses. The player chooses one of the six girls of the Jahana group and has once again to defeat all the others in battle before fighting Kotoe and her bodyguards.

The Bout of Cabalistic Goddess is the second game in the Variable Geo series. It follows the same gameplay template as its predecessor: the player has to fight the other girls in a pre-determined order, winning two rounds out of three. There are five new girls to fight in this sequel. As before, the defeated fighters undergo various humiliating treatments of sexual nature. There are now three erotic scenes per girl, but it's possible to see them only after winning the whole battle, not one scene per round, as it was the case in the first game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Kaori, the nicest looking girl, in my opinion

title: V.G. II: The Bout of Cabalistic Goddess

description:
Viper BTR is a direct sequel to the short story that was part of Viper V12, Magical Gambler. The original story was about a little girl named Ruri who received a magic wand from two dice-shaped familiars, and as a result turned into Chiyomi, a sexy gambling queen who abused her new powers to win money. In Viper BTR, the familiars return and give Ruri another chance to use her powers for good. However, she encounters Mai, another girl who underwent a similar transformation, thanks to her own familiar Domino. But unlike Ruri/Chiyomi, Mai uses her power for good. Will the heroine be able to join her or will envy and greed control her once again?

Viper BTR differs from other Viper games by incorporating a new genre into the usual "choose-your-own-adventure" gameplay, namely mahjong. There is an obligatory mahjong match in the game that the heroine has to win, and also a special "mahjong mode", accessed from the main menu. The rest of the game consists of pictures with text as well as animated sequences; however, unlike in other Viper games, there is rudimentary navigation in "Viper BTR" (at certain points it is possible to choose a location to go to from a menu list). Also not quite typically for a Viper game, the story of "Viper BTR" is not composed entirely of pornographic scenes, and the sexual content is milder than in any other Viper game before.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ruri is reading "Brothers Karamazov" by Dostoevsky. Wait...
Oh, big sister! I'm so glad I met you!..
I'm not a voyeur! No sir!
Now she is Chiyomi, the gambling queen... with huge breasts

title: Viper BTR

description:
Wrestle Angels V1 is a remake of the first title in the series, taking the franchise in a new direction and greatly expanding the simulation elements. Instead of merely teaching a wrestler new moves, as was the case with previous Wrestle Angels games, the player now fully manages a team of female wrestlers, including matches, training, leisure activities, etc. The girls are recruited in the beginning of the game; afterwards, the player has to make a schedule for each girl, and also for their coach. The wrestlers' parameters may increase or decrease depending on the activities the player has chosen for them. However, most of the time, intense training (including running, weight-lifting, etc.) will raise their level greatly.

The matches can be set on auto, trusting one's own training and preparation, or can be controlled manually by selecting moves from a menu. Either way, the outcome of the match is determined by the the level of the wrestlers' training much more than by the choice of moves in the match itself.

sample_screenshots.caption: Looks like she has no chance
Here you can make a schedule for the girls
Another opponent. Looks like she is on drugs or something :)

title: Wrestle Angels V1

description:
Wrestle Angels V3 is the seventh and final PC-98 title in the Wrestle Angels series, again featuring the in-depth management simulation style introduced in Wrestle Angels V1. As usual, Wrestle Angels V3 allows the player to train several female wrestlers, not only controlling their professional training, but also assigning free-time activities and taking them to different locations. All the girls have parameters that can be increased by training in different ways.

Unlike V1 and V2, this title is a completely new entry in the franchise rather than a remake. The familiar wrestlers from the previous games, led by the legendary Mighty Yukiko, have to unite against a new wrestler, who claims to have superior skills. The game has an even heavier emphasis on dialogue and adventure-like elements, with more locations and more personal involvement with the wrestlers. As before, the matches themselves are turn-based, and can be set on auto. This time around, the player can even choose not to see most of the matches displayed at all, with the exception of the most important ones.

sample_screenshots.caption: What can I do for you, lovely lady?..
We are so famous, journalists come to interview us

title: Wrestle Angels V3

description:
The hero of this game is a young lad who leaves his home village on a quest to find a beautiful girl and to marry her. Soon he encounters what might very well be the object of his quest - bathing in a spring in the middle of a forest. Before the hero can say a word, a female demon attacks. The hero scares away the demon, and the lovely girl, who turns out to be Sweet Pea, the daughter of the innkeeper of the village Twin Peaches, takes him to meet his father. But all goes wrong when Sweet Pea's soul gets stolen under mysterious circumstances. The hero descends into the huge underground dungeon in search for answers. And a young nobleman named Dendro, who claims to be Sweet Pea's fiancee, swears to find the soul before the hero does...

Twin Peaches is essentially a first-person dungeon crawler. The only movement is possible in the pseudo-3D environments of a huge, maze-like dungeon (with an auto-map feature). The enemies appear randomly; the battles are turn-based. Enemies are mostly young, pretty, female, and scantily clad (sometimes naked). Defeating enemies gives the hero money, experience points, and "love points", which increase his performance in battles.

sample_screenshots.caption: The hero feels a sudden urge to eat strawberry
Hey girls, don't attack all at once!

title: Twin Peaches

description:
A Midsummer Daytime's Dream Plus is a fairly simple block-sliding puzzle game. The player is shown a picture of a pretty girl. Afterwards, the picture is broken into blocks which are mixed without any order, with one empty block available. The player has to push the blocks around until the picture is complete. The game keeps track of the time the player has needed to complete a puzzle, and of the amount of moves made.

The puzzles' difficulty gradually increases, and so does the "naughtiness" level; in the beginning, the girls wear clothes, but the hardest puzzles feature naked girls.

sample_screenshots.caption: Looks lovely... but harder to assemble
Weird hand-drawn pictures with rather incoherent text appear between the puzzles

title: A Midsummer Daytime's Dream Plus

description:
The game's story is based on a fantasy novel of the same name by Hiroe Suga. In a world with two moons, humans peacefully co-exist with various species of intelligent animals, called "mebu". But something has destroyed the balance in that world, and animals have started to attack humans. A female warrior named Bizantira, accompanied by the yellow bird Diel, decides to find out the reason behind these occurrences and to discover the truth about humans and mebu.

The game is a very basic Japanese-style RPG, with minimal story development and simple gameplay mechanics. The player controls Bizantira as she wanders around the top-down world map, exploring the world and visiting towns. There is no navigation in the towns; locations (such as weapons shop, inn, etc.) are selected through a menu. The battles are random, turn-based, and are viewed from first-person perspective.

sample_screenshots.caption: Bizantira chats with her friend Diel. Maybe he is a chocobo?.. :)
Is this Diel?.. No, that's a hostile yellow bird...

title: Akatsuki no Bizantira

description:
Twelve years have passed since the half-elf Pikto and his friends have defeated the evil demon and restored peace in the world of Arcusas. But evil raises its ugly head one more time. The capital city is attacked, the soldiers are massacred... Is the powerful sorcerer Vido to blame? But Pikto knows that in order to preserve peace in the land, different races - elves, dwarves, humans - have to unite. He must find faithful companions, venture to dangerous places. and save the world once again!

Arcus III returns to the traditional gameplay concept of the first game: the entire game plays from first-person view; pseudo-3D maze-like dungeons are home to randomly appearing enemies, which must be defeated in turn-based combat. Pikto and his companions can also learn a variety of magic spells.

sample_screenshots.caption: This guy looks tough. Better check your equipment...
Harbor. ou can travel to the other continent from here, much later
The movement on the map is not interactive

title: Arcus III

description:
The spaceship "Triant II", carrying an all-female crew under the command of Rachel Hugett, was attacked by mysterious aliens. The captain ordered to fire the strongest weapons, but nothing could help: the aliens invaded the ship...

...and in a unique twist, the player has to control an alien. No information is given about this playable character, that looks like a red crab. It starts at level 1, at the point where it invaded the ship. The game plays like a first-person dungeon crawler (this time the word "crawler" taken quite literally!). The alien moves through the pseudo-3D corridors of the ship. Crew members, robots and machines appear randomly and try to stop it. The battles are turn-based. The alien has two primary kinds of attacks at its disposal: physical attack (with its claw), and electricity attack. Defeating enemies brings experience points, leveling up the creature.

sample_screenshots.caption: Oh no! Aliens are attacking the ship!
And there you are. Playing as an alien. Very weird!

title: Blood Seed

description:
Ares is a young warrior who lives with his old parents in a secluded house on a peninsula. One day he goes to the nearby town, only to find our that four people were missing under mysterious circumstance. Ares decides to help and ventures to the nearby cave, which is said to harbor an evil power. That's where his adventure begins...

Agalta is a fairly traditional Japanese RPG with all the familiar ingredients of the genre: linear progression, party of up to three people, top-down locations and world map, random enemies, turn-based combat viewed from first-person perspective. There is, however, a real-time element in the combat, similar to the ATB system of Final Fantasy series: the player is required to choose menu commands quickly during the battle, since the enemies would attack regardless of whether the command was chosen or not.

sample_screenshots.caption: Yo, I need a room. And an erotic massage! Oh, wait... this is one of those weird NON-HENTAI PC-98 games!
Many treasure chests... but how to access that one?
Ares's parents have a nice house!

title: Agalta

description:
Agalta II picks up right where the first game ended. Ares and his two companions, Seria and Georgie, have defeated the evil and are returning on their airship to the home city of Saladin. Afterwards, they decide to travel on the airship, looking for new adventure. And surely enough, a new adventure begins - but not quite the way they imagined. A storm causes their airship to crash on an unknown continent. The trio of heroes is rescued by the king of Safaya. As a token of gratitude, they decide to help the king defend his land against mysterious monsters that attack it...

Agalta II has the same gameplay system as its predecessor: the party roams the world in top-down fashion and fight their way through dungeons infested by randomly appearing enemies that have to be defeated in first-person-view, turn-based combat; and as before, the time that passes between turns is displayed as an indicator on the battle screen, like in Final Fantasy games.

sample_screenshots.caption: Romantic conversation on the world map? Something like this
Hey, that's a bit... sexy. Tribute to hentai?..
Girl + bed + protagonist + PC-98 = hentai? Nope!..

title: Agalta II

description:
The events of Agalta 3 immediately follow those described in the previous game. The thousand-year old struggle, which began with the Demon King Zozem using the Powers of Chaos against the gods, is nearing its end. Three brave heroes - Ares, Seria, and Georgie - ventured into the World of Spirits to restore balance in the universe. As they continue their journey, a mysterious powerful magician attacks them. They are brought to the house of Dr. K., a local scientist. Seria becomes gravely ill; to save her, Ares and the Doctor go to the nearby forest in search of cure...

Agalta 3 differs from the two previous installments of the series by eliminating random battles in favor of visible enemies who roam the world map and dungeon-like areas. When the controllable character comes into contact with an enemy, a battle ensues. The first-person-view battles are now completely turn-based, the turn indicator being displayed merely for convenience (enemies will not attack while the player is choosing commands from the menu).

sample_screenshots.caption: Forest dungeon. Note the visible enemies
Hey, don't shout. We're all civilized people here. I'm sure we can solve the problem without violence
A pub. Booze, games, and girls for hire (maybe). Ahh... life is good
This one is a boss. He hits hard...
What? You go ON the beds instead of THROUGH them?..

title: Agalta 3

alternate_titles.title: Alvaleak Bōkenki: The History of Adventure in Alvaleak Continent

description:
The land of Alvaleak is home to many explorers and adventures who hunt for rare treasures. Three such adventurers descended once into a mysterious cave - and no one has ever heard from them afterwards. Their children grew up and became adventurers themselves, members of the adventurers' guild: the boy Riva and the girl Emily. One day they are entrusted with a dangerous assignment: explore the so-called "diamond cave", grab the treasures, and report to the superiors. The young heroes do not now that this is just the beginning of a grand journey, during which they will discover the truth about what happened to their fathers...

Made by the creators of Emerald Dragon, Alvaleak Boukenki is a Japanese-style RPG that plays almost entirely from first-person perspective (except short and linear transitions on the top-down map). All the locations (including towns) are displayed as dungeon-like areas. In dangerous locations (caves, towers, etc.), enemies appear randomly. The turn-based battles can be set on auto. The player-controlled party of characters (up to four) uses guns as their weapons; bullets must also be bought from weapon shops. There are no magic spells in the game. All the areas are auto-mapped as the player explores them.

sample_screenshots.caption: The top-down map is small and very linear
Boss battle against somebody from the past...

title: Alvaleak Bōkenki

description:
Amaranth IV continues the over-arching story of the series. The main heroine in this game is not Liann Fremdes, the usual protagonist of Amaranth games, but his lovely elf companion Din. After visiting the ancient city of Posse and meeting some new friends, Din heads to the capital city of Stellar to meet prince Deinass, whom she helped eight years ago during events described in the previous game. But shadows from the past keep haunting the young prince. His sister is kidnapped by an old acquaintance. Din, Deinass, and their friends must do everything they can to bring her back and to stop a new threat to the kingdom.

Similarly to the previous game, Amaranth IV contains elements of strategy RPGs: limited exploration, rare and story-dictated battles, and turn-based combat with free movement on the battle field. However, it gets rid of the "vigour" and action points system of the previous game, in favor of simpler gameplay. The player-controlled characters act in turns, and can usually move and execute a physical attack (or cast a spell) one time per turn. Some weapons require specific placement on the field (for example, bows require a character equipped with them to stand diagonally across the enemy in order to be able to attack). Character receive experience points and level up after defeating enemies; fallen character are resurrected to full health after battles. Instead of the usual top-down view, Amaranth IV uses isometric perspective for battles and exploration.

sample_screenshots.caption: Outside of a synagogue. Or so it looks like! :-)
It's night... outside of Stellar castle
Din's attack range is diagonal, since she is an archer

title: Amaranth IV

description:
Amaranth KH is a side-story in the Amaranth series, and can be considered a prequel to all the previous games; it doesn't feature the same heroes, but is set in the same universe, at a much earlier time, when the kingdom of Stellar was not yet built and when Posse was a flourishing city. The game tells the story of Landschaft, a young warrior in the army or Rauschritt. He trains in the Posse camp with his best friend Dienstag and the lovely Jungfer. He is well-known for his courage, but he first needs to prove himself worthy of being a true night. It began as an educational battle for the young hero, but soon a chain of events forced him to fight for his life and for his country.

Amaranth KH is the radical conclusion to the series' tendency to strategy elements; it discards the RPG elements (movement outside of a battle screen, exploration, etc.) in favor of a traditional Japanese-style turn-based strategy game with a RPG angle (leveling up). The player commands Landschaft, his friends, and their units, moving them on the battle screen and attacking enemies when they are in their weapons' range. There are different types of units: infantry, cavalry, archers, magicians, etc. Some battle elements were taken from the previous game (such as archers attacking diagonally). Strong, story-related characters (generals) can fight alone against an entire unit of "nameless" characters. Every attack is displayed as a separate picture, graphically depicting ts results. If the attack is initiated by the enemy, the player can choose to counter-attack.

sample_screenshots.caption: The boss tells you about your exam
Our hero. Hey, I liked Din better...

title: Amaranth KH: Stellar Ōkoku Kenkokutan

description:
The content of the game can be easily deduced from its title ("Kinbaku Jinmon Densetsu" means the legend of bondage interrogation). The game contains three "episodes", unrelated to each other story-wise. The first one is set in medieval times and tells about the adventures of two female treasure hunters in an ancient tomb; the second begins with two young girls being kidnapped by a mysterious secret society; the third deals with three school girls being assaulted by a thief.

The three episodes are quite short; the gameplay consists of occasionally making a choice. Wrong choices lead to premature "bad ends", as the game calls them. The rest of the game is spend looking at still pictures, most of which - as the title implies - depicts sadistic sexual encounters and torture.

sample_screenshots.caption: Torture scenes: that's what this game is about
The thief took all our clothes and left... I guess it's a bad ending after all
Episode III. One of the few "peaceful" erotic scenes here...
You'll see this screen a lot

title: BIND: Kinbaku Jinmon Densetsu

description:
In th early 21st century, Tokyo became the center of advance scientific research. Ground-breaking discoveries were made in the field of computer science, as well as re-discovering the ancient art of magic. A crime organization known as Digital Beast emerged, controlling much of the new technological resources. The organization became so powerful that the authorities were unable to stop its activities. A mercenary named Lightning (or "Light" for short) recently joined a special group named Black Bird. One of his assignments involves investigating strange occurrences in the New Planning company building, which might lead him on the trail of Digital Beast.

Black Bird is a solo dungeon crawler (with auto-map feature): the gameplay consists of exploring maze-like passages in pseudo-3D environment, fighting randomly appearing enemies. The game features card-based combat. Lightning and his opponent are dealt a deck of cards. The goal is to get rid of single cards and to build combinations (three of a kind, straight, etc.), a bit similarly to a poker game. A successfully built combination inflicts damage on the enemy. There are also defense-strengthening and healing cards, which the player can use between the combinations. Beside that, the game has a traditional RPG system with hit points, experience points, leveling up, money management, equipment, etc.

The adult content appears mostly during battles, with enemies who look like pretty girls and remove some (or all) of their clothes when defeated.

sample_screenshots.caption: The cool hero in the car
Fighting a random girl in green dress
Random girl in green dress defeated. Panty visibility

title: Black Bird: Toritachi no Tooboe

description:
The country of Fiberia has enjoyed the blessing of the Goddess. But as their king discovered an old manuscript, an ancient evil was called into the world. Was Balcan, the sorcerer killed by the great warrior Ares, the only one who knew how to stop evil? It's time for Ares to understand the meaning of Balcan's final words. Maybe the young sorceress Dela, still on a quest to avenge her teacher's death, can forgive Ares and join forces with him. Meanwhile, a new player appears - Unber, the female champion of Castle Town...

Spirit of Balcan has the same gameplay system as the previous entries in the series: the player navigates the character through the top-down world (the camera rotates with each turn of the player character), fighting enemies in real-time combat and gaining experience points. Characters can also visit "friendly" areas, where they can buy and equip weapons and armor. The interface is point-and-click, with selectable icons for looking, searching, and attacking. It is also possible (and sometimes necessary) to jump up and backwards. Unlike the previous Brandish games, Spirit of Balcan allows the player to control different characters, starting with Unber and later switching to Ares and Dela.

sample_screenshots.caption: This guy is a doctor? Maybe a doctor, who knows... - as the Sad Servant of Barmalei from "Aybolit 66" would say :)

title: Brandish 3: Spirit of Balcan

description:
Somewhere in the desert of Kalua, in the country of Suelang, stands a huge tower. This is the Tower of Fata Morgana. Legends say that powerful ancient wisdom is hidden in this tower. But no one dares to venture in, fearing ferocious monsters and deadly traps. Three people, however, are exception to this rule: the young thief Dee, who hopes to steal treasure from the tower; the lovely elf witch Clare, who needs to discover ancient magic; and finally, a mysterious man named Quien, who doesn't remember his past and works as a mercenary...

Brandish VT is the fourth installment of the Brandish series. It abandons the over-arching story of the previous titles and tells a completely unrelated tale. The player is able to choose Dee, Clare, or Quien as the playable character right from the beginning. Each one of them starts in a different location, but eventually will have to face the riddles of the Tower. The gameplay is similar to the previous Brandish games, with point-and-click interface (or keyboard short-cuts), real-time combat, and the ability to jump. As before, there is a RPG system with experience points and levels. The game abandons the top-down view of the previous games, using isometric perspective.
title: Brandish VT

description:
This game (which has nothing to do either with the ZX Spectrum adventure or the Mac action game) is set in what appears to be an alternate version of the Earth. A race of demi-humans has emerged, threatening the existence of humanity. The 15th human Emperor, named Sigmatoro J. Salzstein, calls Duke Erich B. Zweiss, and explains to him the mission: recover ancient crystals from the demi-humans, which alone can save humanity. But the Duke should be careful: who knows what challenges await for him among the demi-humans, outside of the safe walls of the capital city Berlin?..

Crystal Quest is a puzzle game with adventure elements - the Duke's top-down movement and the ability to access different locations to tackle different puzzles. The locations are marked on the world map as towers and caves; in each one of them, a sexy demi-human will offer a challenge to the good Duke. The puzzles include a tile-matching memory game and a timed top-down maze sprint (find the exit before the time runs out). In each subsequent area, the difficulty of these puzzles increases, and the amount of clothes the demi-humans wear after a puzzle has been solved decreases.

The music in this game includes famous classical compositions by J.S.Bach, Tchaikovsky, Satie, etc.

sample_screenshots.caption: Say, where do they sell such panties?
The imperial capital Berlin? Bismarck would be proud...
... .... .... maybe I don't need to solve this? It already looks good enough :)

title: Crystal Quest

description:
The game is based on the animated movie Legend of Crystania, which is set in the same universe as Record of Lodoss War, telling the story of two of its characters, Ashram and Pirotessa, escaping to the cursed land of Crystania and falling into the hand of animal gods. The game, however, doesn't follow this plot and instead is focusing on Crystania's internal troubles, particularly the evil Dragon God, whom the animal gods must defeat. The player can choose to play as either the female warrior Jenoba from the country of Istaria, or Pirotessa's former companion Boakes. The two adventures have different plots and begin in different locations.

The game's exploration is on par with other Japanese top-down RPGs, including towns and hostile areas, but without a world map. The battles are pre-set. Once the player-controlled party encounters a hostile character, a turn-based battle begins. The combat has a strategy element, allowing character to freely move on the battle field and attack only if enemies are within the range of their weapons. Characters can cast magical spells or use "talents", which deplete TP, or "talent points".

sample_screenshots.caption: Boakes finds another village. Boakes finds it boring. Boakes goes away
The diary records all the conversations

title: Shin'ō Densetsu Crystania

description:
A young man finds a mysterious box. Making sure no one is at home, he opens the box and finds a scroll with a magic incantation inside. He chants the magic spell - and immediately a cute female elf appears. She says she can create any girl the hero wants. But once the girl is created, he has to figure out how to win her good graces...

Custom Mate can be called a "seduction simulator". Lacking the adventure elements of Cocktail's most famous series, Can Can Bunny, Custom Mate offers much deeper simulation gameplay instead. In the beginning of the game, the player effectively "creates" the girl he will need to seduce; it is possible to choose age, height, breast size, hair style, and personality. Mixing all these parameters results in different girls who require different approach. For example, an older, experienced and direct woman might appreciate physical stimulation (kissing etc.), while a young shy girl needs to talk more before the hero can afford any straight-forward actions.

The gameplay is menu-driven - the player can choose to talk, to ask, to look, to touch, to kiss, and to take off the girl's clothes. Choosing one of these actions usually leads to a sub-menu, which varies depending on the girl and the current situation. For example, the "talk" menu usually brings a large sub-menu of more precise actions ("praise", "order", "beg", etc.), each of which opens new sub-menus. Similarly, physical interaction can also become quite detailed: the "kiss" command opens a sub-menu ("lick", "bite", etc.). Physical interaction is made more precise by implementing a point-and-click interface; in many cases, choosing the exact body part to interact with can be a matter of "life and death", since it is possible to make a girl very angry, which might lead to a Game Over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Thanks for the magic box, but... can we move to PRETTY women, please?..
All right! Just be careful with her tricky questions
Second stage! Gotta ask how she feels now
The girl of my dreams. Are you ready?
Direct personality. Age: older than the hero... We may safely assume the hero is a teenager :)

title: Custom Mate

description:
The second game in the Custom Mate series once again allows the hero to create the girl of his dreams; this time not magically, but by engaging the services of Custom Corporation, whose operator is nevertheless still the same cute elf who created the girls in the previous game.

The "girl creation" part offers more possibilities than before, such as exact bra size or the clothes the girl will wear (school girl, nurse, etc.). This allows more combinations and therefore more different girls. The "seduction simulator" part is simplified compared to the first game. Instead of menu-based interface, initiating conversations, and physical interaction, the entire seduction part is composed of a conversation between the protagonist and the girl. The dialogue/action choices, however, are numerous and varied. The difficulty level varies greatly depending on the girl's personality, age, profession, etc.

sample_screenshots.caption: Character creation complete. Are you ready?
No worries, says the cute elf, let's create another girl...
Slam! This scenario is way harder
Detailed interaction. At this point, it's really hard to lose...

title: Custom Mate 2

description:
Angie and Ruby are two ordinary young girls: they like spending time together, talking about fashion, men, and all the usual stuff. But one day, they see a very strange man - dressed in a rabbit costume, with a gigantic erected penis... The two girls try to flee, but instead end up in an alternate dimension - a bizarre world called Decadence Land. This world is populated by grotesque characters with only sex in mind. Now Angie and Ruby have to figure out a way to escape from this dangerous world and to return home...

Daraku no Kuni no Angie is an adventure/RPG hybrid. Movement on the top-down map of Decadence Land is done by clicking on a location icon. The plot is advanced when the player chooses a correct action, unlocking new locations. However, some actions can only be performed when certain items are acquired. Both girls have RPG-like statistics, including a health bar and a "perversity level", which corresponds to normal levels in traditional RPGs. There are also more precise statistics which refer to particular sexual parameters and activities (such as "anal level", "vagina stamina", etc.). When the girls are moving on the world map, random encounters with the weird inhabitants of Decadence Land can occur.
