The game uses a single attack key for all the actions; items are collected automatically when Bargon bumps into their containers. It is possible to use healing items as well as teleport to the entrance of a location.

sample_screenshots.caption: Bargon has finished his black deed
Bargon is killing a man in his bed
Intro. Two children are assaulted by a guy; Bargon will appear soon and kill them all...

title: Sakusaku Daigōtō Returns

description:
The background story of Satyr is rather vague: the main character (default name Momojirou) is hired for two weeks to help a female gardener named Ayaka to grow flowers for celestial creatures - also female, young, and cute, though with elf-like ears and sometimes even wings. The goal here is to learn enough about different flowers, the ways to make them grow, and the preferences of the girls.

The player is given exactly fourteen days of game time to accomplish this task. From the main screen it is possible to access information about flowers, check the weather conditions, talk to the girls (one time with each girl), then decide which flowers to plant. It is then possible to choose again with which girl to talk; sometimes they will ask different questions (about various topics, but mostly concerning flowers), and the answers will also influence their attitude towards the main character. Afterwards, a day of game time will pass. If the player is successful, the satisfied girls will pose naked, and eventually have sex with the hero.
title: Satyr

description:
Seiken to Maken no Densetsu tells a rather traditional story of a young boy named Aleph, who grew up in the village of Oron, part of the Veryland Empire. His father, Garland, was a mighty warrior who was killed ten years ago. Now Aleph has grown up and must follow in his father's footsteps, starting with exterminations of nearby hostile goblins. Naturally, this is just the beginning of a grand quest that will eventually turn into a world-saving mission and restoration of the balance between different races in the world.

The gameplay is as traditional as the story: a basic Japanese-style party-based RPG with little to no extra features. The heroes roam the top-down world map, fight random enemies in turn-based combat viewed from first-person perspective, automatically level up, automatically learn new magic spells that require magic points, visit villages to rest and buy supplies, and descend into dungeons. Later in the game the player will also be able to navigate a ship to access previously locked locations.
title: Seiken to Maken no Densetsu

description:
The game with such a simple, yet expressive title is also rather simple and to-the-point in its concept: it is about having sex and nothing else. There is no real story in the game: in the beginning, a crazy-looking character named Mr. Funk, who speaks in Japanese with a heavy dose of stereotypical hip-hop lingo, announces that the player is now declared King of Sex and can therefore directly have sex with any of the three "available" young and pretty girls: Nana, the cute school girl, Makoto, the "mature" woman (probably in her early twenties), and the obligatory underage girl with pink hair, Ai.

The gameplay is dedicated entirely to sex, and features so many possibilities and precise commands, that Sex can be considered a simulation game. The goal is achieved with ease, since the player character has access to sexual activities right from the beginning. However, in order to see all the graphics, the player has to deplete every possible "activity tree", making choices between the player character's precise actions and ultimately changing the "course of the intercourse".

sample_screenshots.caption: Depending on your choices, the girls will wear different costumes
Ai is taking off her panties

title: Sex

description:
Sex 2 has the same basic premise as its predecessor, which is easy to deduce from the game's title. It's all about engaging in the titular pleasurable activity, and doing it in various "creative" ways. Unlike the first Sex, there is only one girl in Sex 2: Ayaka, the cute flower-raising character from Satyr, another game by the same company.

As in Satyr, the player character default name is Momojirou (nicknamed Momo-chan), and he is Ayaka's boyfriend. There is no real story in the game; Momojirou visits Ayaka at her flower shop every day and has sex with her. However, events might occur between their sexual encounters, adding an item to the hero's inventory, which can later be used for their mutual pleasure. There is no way to "lose" the game, but in order to unlock all the graphics, the player has to experiment with various precise sexual choices and items that are at his disposal.
title: Sex 2

description:
In 1999, Armageddon came to the world. Japanese researchers have experimented with genetics and biological mutations; as a result, a new race of powerful demons known as shiki-oni emerged, and in a short time has conquered the Earth, obliterating most of human civilization.

Hayato, the young hero of the game, is a son to a human mother and the Demon Dragon, the most powerful shiki-oni. His ultimate goal is to defeat his own father and save the remnants of the human race.

Shiki Oni no Koku: Chūgokuhen is an episodic game. There are no differences between the episodes gameplay-wise or graphically; each episode simply continues the story from the point it was left off in the end of the previous episode.

The gameplay is "light" Japanese-style RPG, characteristic for many Compile games: there are no weapons and armor; the magic system is very simple and rudimentary; there are only very few NPCs and friendly areas, and no real towns; most of the game is spent exploring the maze-like top-down dungeons, in which the party of player-controlled characters (up to 4) fights enemies in traditional turn-based combat viewed from first-person perspective. However, unlike most Japanese RPGs of the time, the enemies are visibly wandering on the screen, and the battle begins when there is a physical contact between them and the player character.

The first episode follows the adventures of Hayato and his friends as they explore their home town invaded by demons, trying to find the path that would lead to Hayato's father. The characters can reach level 10 in this episode.

sample_screenshots.caption: The hero Hayato with his eagle Hayate

title: Shiki Oni no Koku: Chūgokuhen - Daiisshō

description:
In 1999, Armageddon came to the world. Japanese researchers have experimented with genetics and biological mutations; as a result, a new race of powerful demons known as shiki-oni emerged, and in a short time has conquered the Earth, obliterating most of human civilization.

Hayato, the young hero of the game, is a son to a human mother and the Demon Dragon, the most powerful shiki-oni. His ultimate goal is to defeat his own father and save the remnants of the human race.

Shiki Oni no Koku: Chūgokuhen is an episodic game. There are no differences between the episodes gameplay-wise or graphically; each episode simply continues the story from the point it was left off in the end of the previous episode.

The gameplay is "light" Japanese-style RPG, characteristic for many Compile games: there are no weapons and armor; the magic system is very simple and rudimentary; there are only very few NPCs and friendly areas, and no real towns; most of the game is spent exploring the maze-like top-down dungeons, in which the party of player-controlled characters (up to 4) fights enemies in traditional turn-based combat viewed from first-person perspective. However, unlike most Japanese RPGs of the time, the enemies are visibly wandering on the screen, and the battle begins when there is a physical contact between them and the player character.

The second episode starts with the heroes at character level 10. After the dramatic events at the end of the previous episode, Hayato, his eagle Hayate, and the girl Haruka are saved by a man who lives in an abandoned temple. From there, they have to continue their journey, searching for the Heavenly King of the West and his palace.
title: Shiki Oni no Koku: Chūgokuhen - Dainishō

description:
In 1999, Armageddon came to the world. Japanese researchers have experimented with genetics and biological mutations; as a result, a new race of powerful demons known as shiki-oni emerged, and in a short time has conquered the Earth, obliterating most of human civilization.

Hayato, the young hero of the game, is a son to a human mother and the Demon Dragon, the most powerful shiki-oni. His ultimate goal is to defeat his own father and save the remnants of the human race.

Shiki Oni no Koku: Chūgokuhen is an episodic game. There are no differences between the episodes gameplay-wise or graphically; each episode simply continues the story from the point it was left off in the end of the previous episode.

However, unlike most Japanese RPGs of the time, the enemies are visibly wandering on the screen, and the battle begins when there is a physical contact between them and the player character.

The third episode begins when Hayate and his friends are at level 20, and have already reached the palace of the Heavenly King of the West. There, they must overcome all the obstacles and solve the riddles in order to reach their goal. But they know that the most important battle is still ahead...

sample_screenshots.caption: More mazes, more puzzles. This episode is very monotonous
Puzzle: step on the colored tiles in the correct order

title: Shiki Oni no Koku: Chūgokuhen - Daisanshō

description:
In 1999, Armageddon came to the world. Japanese researchers have experimented with genetics and biological mutations; as a result, a new race of powerful demons known as shiki-oni emerged, and in a short time has conquered the Earth, obliterating most of human civilization.

Hayato, the young hero of the game, is a son to a human mother and the Demon Dragon, the most powerful shiki-oni. His ultimate goal is to defeat his own father and save the remnants of the human race.

Shiki Oni no Koku: Chūgokuhen is an episodic game. There are no differences between the episodes gameplay-wise or graphically; each episode simply continues the story from the point it was left off in the end of the previous episode.

The gameplay is "light" Japanese-style RPG, characteristic for many Compile games: there are no weapons and armor; the magic system is very simple and rudimentary; there are only very few NPCs and friendly areas, and no real towns; most of the game is spent exploring the maze-like top-down dungeons, in which the party of player-controlled characters (up to 4) fights enemies in traditional turn-based combat viewed from first-person perspective. However, unlike most Japanese RPGs of the time, the enemies are visibly wandering on the screen, and the battle begins when there is a physical contact between them and the player character.

This is the final episode of the story. The characters start at level 30. They have to find the remaining Heavenly Kings on the Earth. They are taken to the illusion city ruled by the Heavenly Queen of the North. The heroes must face ghosts from the past and eventually fulfill their mission, saving the humanity from the yoke of the demons.
title: Shiki Oni no Koku: Chūgokuhen - Daiyonshō

description:
In the beginning of 23rd century, Japan has turned into a huge megalopolis. More and more urban areas were built. The largest building of all times was erected in Osaka and named "Atlas Tower".

But the day before the opening ceremony, two mysterious characters appear in front of the tower - a demonic-looking man and woman. The man, who calls himself Tanoma, announces that "their time has finally come". It's up to the young amateur detective Naruto to unravel this mystery, and prevent a terrible disaster.

Shinwaden: Hatō no Shō is an adventure game. True to its Japanese origins, the game has no inventory management, puzzles, dialogue trees, or other elements of a Western adventure. However, unlike most Japanese adventures, Shinwaden: Hatō no Shō has real physical movement. Most of the game is spent navigating the top-down districts of Osaka, entering buildings, and talking to people, trying to advance the plot. Only a few occasions feature the traditional still "Look/Talk/Think" menu.

There are some scenes with nudity in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: They look rather... harmless, don't they?..

title: Shinwaden: Hatō no Shō

description:
The great womanizing detective Max, whom we met in the first Shiritsu Tantei Max game is back! This time, he is taken to a magical parallel dimension, which is populated by elemental spirits. It turns out that the Galactic Orb that was in Max's possession awakened the evil witch Morgan, who had been previously sealed by the elemental rulers. Balance is destroyed, and magical creatures have gone berserk. Together with his companion, the little pixie Viewer, Max has to undo the damage and stop Morgan from taking over the world.

Unlike the first game, Shiritsu Tantei Max 2: Master of Elemental is an RPG. It plays like a fairly traditional Japanese-style representative of the genre: the player navigates Max over the top-down world, fighting random enemies in turn-based fashion, and visiting towns for rest and supplies. Characters have typical RPG proficiencies (for example, Viewer has low HP and weak attacks, but can cast healing magic, etc.). The characters level up automatically, as per standard Japanese RPG rule.

The adult content comes in form of over-sexed female demonic enemies, some of which fully undress upon defeat, as well as during Max's dates. In towns, the player can use the special "Hunt" command to locate the available girls. Some of them will agree to date Max. Staying at the inn will then trigger an erotic picture with the girl in question.
title: Shiritsu Tantei Max 2: Master of Elemental

description:
A space ship was sent to the planet Neptune, to investigate strange disturbances spotted on the planet's surface. Some time later, the nearest space station picked up a SOS signal from the ship. An agent named Takuya, in command of an elite team of female fighters, is sent to Neptune. But their ship crashes, and Takuya must fight for his life and the lives of the girls, which are threatened by Neptune's fearsome monsters.

Star Trap is an adult visual novel. The gameplay consists entirely of making choices. The choices are always situation-specific and don't allow any real interaction with the environment; there is no fixed verb-based menu. Rather than influencing the main story, the choices made by the player unlock (or lock) the CG, most of which are dedicated to various acts of sexual nature.
title: Star Trap

description:
Arigawa is just an ordinary Japanese teenager, who attends an ordinary Japanese high school. At least he was ordinary until he met Mimi, the charming new exchange student. One day, being a perfect gentleman, Arigawa walked her home after the school, but was attacked by angry female martial artists. Mimi reveals to him that she has studied esoteric martial skills by a man known simply as "The Teacher". Unfortunately, not every one who knows these secret techniques uses them for the good. The young hero gets involved in a conflict from which there is no escape...

Super Battle Skin Panic is a hybrid of Japanese-style adventure and card-based battles. During the adventure part, the player clicks on one of the three available commands ("Look", "Talk", and "Move") to interact with the environment. As in most Japanese adventures, there is no puzzles or other kind of challenge, and at most screens the player simply has to deplete all the commands to proceed.

The battles are pre-set and follow a turn-based pattern. The player controls Mimi. Both player-controlled character and the enemy are dealt five cards, one of which the player has to "play"; after the turn is over, the player is dealt a new card. The cards work like battle command: attack, defense, etc. A special card is "undress", which, unsurprisingly, makes the character remove some of her clothes or even get completely naked. Both Mimi and the enemy have a "shame" meter, which can be reduced (or raised) by playing certain cards. The higher the shame meter, the more the character feels ashamed of her nudity, which leads to decrease in combat performance.

sample_screenshots.caption: She looks cute when she's ashamed... time to play the Joker!

title: Super Battle Skin Panic

description:
It all began very innocently: a beauty contest in a quiet Japanese town. The hero, an ordinary young man (default name Fukai Rei), is happy to look at pretty women. But everything goes terribly wrong. A huge demon appears, sending his minions and invading the town. Accidentally, the hero meets several angel-like girls with supernatural powers. They tell him that they were banned to live on the Earth for hundreds of years, but time has come for them to reunite and to fight the forces of darkness - naturally, under the hero's guidance!

Super Erecto Taisen: S・EX is a strategy game with strong RPG elements. The player commands a party consisting of the hero and the angelic female fighters. The goal is to fight through several stages (marked on the map) in any order, defeating the occupying demonic forces. The characters move on the top-down battle field in round-based fashion, attacking when an opponent is on a nearby field. When attacked, the player has the choice of counter-attack or defense. Attacks are shown as small animated sequences at the bottom of the screen. Defeating enemies result in experience points and money, which can be spent to buy equipment for the player-controlled characters.
title: Super Erecto Taisen: S・EX

description:
Three of a Perfect Pair is a simple puzzle game: the player is shown a picture that consists of blocks; after a few seconds, the blocks are randomly mixed up, and the player's task is to re-arrange them into a full picture again, by manipulating them one at a time, using the only available empty block space.

All the pictures display pretty young girls; in the first few levels they wear clothes, while later levels feature nudity and even lesbian sex scenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: The title screen is also a puzzle :)

title: Three of a Perfect Pair

description:
Reimu Hakurei is a "shrine maiden", a young girl whose job was to protect shrines of the Shinto religion in feudal Japan. The fabric of reality is torn when demons from the parallel realm known as "Illusion Village" invade the human world through the shrine Reimu is guarding. The young girl must defeat the demons and seal the entrance from the other world.

The first of the Tōhō series is similar to Breakout-style games, since it is composed of one-screen levels, with the typical goal of destroying all the bricks (cards, in the case of this game) by manipulating a ball. However, unlike in most Breakout clones, the player controls a real character (Reimu) instead of a traditional paddle. The specific gameplay mechanics are also a bit different: the ball cannot fall "below the ground"; if it hits Reimu, she loses a life; the player has to press a corresponding key to hit the ball in close range.

The game can also be considered a shooter, since Reimu can (and often has to) shoot the ball when it is high in the air, to change its trajectory and destroy cards. Also, after every five "regular" levels there is a "boss level", which plays similarly to top-down shooters, and during which Reimu also has to defend herself from projectiles shot by the boss, either dodging or shooting them.

sample_screenshots.caption: Get this letter for more points!
Here, the only way to get the ball to the upper level is through the bulleye

title: Tōhō: Reiiden

description:
Block Quest V is a Breakout clone with adult content. The player must keep the ball from falling out the bottom of the screen, while at the same time attempting to destroy all the blocks on the screen using the ball. There are no powerups, but there are a wide variety of different block types including blocks that switch on and off and blocks that move. The player can also shake the playfield to adjust the ball's trajectory, much like tilting in a pinball game. If the game continues for long enough, the ball will move faster and faster, but will eventually explode into three separate balls which move slower again.

There are a total of nine areas with eleven stages each. Each area has a theme (hospital, restaurant, school), and a girl who matches the theme (nurse, waitress, student). As the player clears the stages, the player is rewarded with several pictures of the "stage girl" in varying stages of undress.

sample_screenshots.caption: The green blocks here take several hits to destroy.
These green blocks have a nasty habit of replicating until the counter reaches one.

title: Block Quest V

description:
Reimu Hakurei, the young shrine maiden, has left the Hakurei shrine to train her newly discovered powers with the magical Yin-Yang orbs. When she returns, she finds the shrine desecrated, invaded by powerful demons. Riding her new friend, the turtle Genji, Reimu has to fight her way through hordes of enemies in order to defeat their demonic lords.

The second installment in the Tōhō series abandons the breakout/shooter hybrid concept of the first game in favor of more traditional vertically scrolling shooter gameplay. The turtle replaces the traditional space ship, but otherwise Tōhō: Fūmaroku plays very similarly to other so-called bullet hell shooters, with multiple enemies on the screen attacking at once, and ferocious bosses with their unique attack patterns. Reimu's turtle can upgrade its shooting abilities by eating various letters dropped from above. Reimu can also use a limited amount of bombs, which cause massive damage to all the enemies at once.

sample_screenshots.caption: Now this is simply not nice
The enemies team up for a desperate attack

title: Tōhō: Fūmaroku

description:
Mysterious ruins were discovered in the vicinity of the Hakurei shrine in old Japan. Reimu Hakurei, the shrine maiden, wants to explore the ruins; to her astonishment, other young girls with supernatural powers are also interested in the ruins. Rumor has it that the heart of the ruins contains a source of unimaginable power. Reimu must now compete against the other girls in order to be the first to enter the core of the ruins.

The third entry in the Tōhō series is, like the second, a vertically scrolling shooter. However, Tōhō: Yumejikū can only be played as a versus game (split-screen, for two players or one player against computer). Choosing any of the five available playable girls, the player has to compete against another character, going through the same stages; the boss enemy of a stage is the actual other character.

Like in the previous game, each character has a limited amount of bombs to inflict massive damage on all enemies on screen. A new feature is a special attack, which is unique to each girl, including various powerful attacks such as a laser ray, revolving orbs that destroy enemies on their way, shots sent to different directions, etc.

sample_screenshots.caption: The four green orbs is my special power
This special attack doesn't look very intimidating

title: Tōhō: Yumejikū

description:
All seems peaceful at the Hakurei Shrine, which has been target for demonic invasions several times. Naturally, things can't go this way forever: a new demonic army emerges from the mountain lake nearby. Reimu, the shrine maiden, must once again face the demons. But this time, an old rival - a young witch named Marisa - decides to play her own game, crossing Reimu's way...

Tōhō: Gensōkyō is the fourth entry in the Tōhō series. Gameplay-wise, it returns to the single-player vertically scrolling shooter template first introduced in the second game. The game looks and plays similarly, also featuring many recurrent enemies; however, there are more different upgrades, including a new mode that slows down the enemies' movement. Also, the player can choose whether to play as Reimu or as Marisa, who has her own weapon upgrades and attacks.
title: Tōhō: Gensōkyō

description:
The dark lord Galuf has ambitions to take over the world, and there's only one thing left that he needs: three magic seals, said to be the most powerful weapons in existence. When he comes to the castle where they are hidden, the princess entrusts them to a fairy to find help. She escapes the castle and finds three young travelers of improbable hair colors: Rare, Medium, and Well. The fairy entrusts each girl with one of the seals, and they set off to defeat Galuf, rescue the princess, and restore peace to the kingdom.

Totsugeki! Mix is a cute action platform game. Choosing one of the three girls, each with their own unique weapon, the player must travel through ten different stages fighting Galuf's unreasonably cute army. There are several different special magic powers that can be collected, including a fairy familiar, magic shield, and time slow, and a boss waits at the end of each stage.

sample_screenshots.caption: I wanna fly high, higher than all of the heavens!
This is a pretty sweet level.

title: Totsugeki! Mix

description:
No rest for the wicked - that's something Reimu Hakurei, a young girl guarding the medieval Japanese Hakurei shrine, has understood during her eventful life. Demons from a parallel dimension have chosen her shrine as an entry to our earth, from which they begin their invasions. This time they appeared in the mountain cave, and Reimu must stop them before they conquer the entire world. But this time, she is not alone...

The fifth entry in the Tōhō series follows the traditional vertically scrolling shooter template first introduced in the second game. Enemies, level design, collecting weapon upgrades, using a limited amount of powerful "bombs" - all the elements from the other Tōhō games are present here. Like in the previous entry, the witch Marisa, Reimu's rival, is a playable character; in Tōhō: Kaikidan, two more characters "join the club", the demonic (though looking like young cute girls) Mima and Yuka, who starred as boss enemies in the fourth game.

sample_screenshots.caption: The bosses take me to their own realms

title: Tōhō: Kaikidan

description:
The protagonist of the game is assigned to supervise and lead a group known as Tuned Heart, which fights crime on city streets. The members of the group are all young and pretty girls, and also experts in firearms and vehicles. Mysterious mind-controlling criminals have appeared in America, and now cities are overrun by biker gangs and other criminals. It's time for the hero to assemble his group and show those criminals who is the boss!

Tuned Heart is a turn-based strategy game with strong RPG elements. Characters are moved around on vast top-down battle fields, attacking enemies with pistols and other weapons. Characters also receive experience points and gain levels, in a RPG fashion. Beside the usual weapon-related attributes, it is possible to customize the vehicles driven by the characters, and their strength can influence the outcome of battles.
title: Tuned Heart

description:
Wind's Seed tells the story of sister and brother, Meena and Otto, who possess the unique power of "call", allowing them to focus spiritual energy in order to cast magical spells. Once they arrive in a small village, they are asked to go to the Western forest, presumably to help gather some healing plants. However, they soon learn that it was a trap, and must defend themselves in order to survive...

Even though it looks like a side-scrolling action game, Wind's Seed is essentially a "light" Japanese-style RPG, with the characteristic random enemies, turn-based combat, and automatic leveling up. There are also peaceful areas with inns and shops, where they can acquire healing and support items. The player controls only Meena and Otto. In every battle, it is necessary to raise the "call level" of them, in order to unleash more damaging spells; with a low call level, they won't be able to defeat their foes. Otto also has the ability to heal the party.
title: Wind's Seed

description:
Long time ago, human beings, animals, and supernatural creatures lived together peacefully in the Garden of Eden. But a demon named Ibrus started a war against the god of time, and as a result the peaceful co-existence of different races ended. Humans were deported onto the Earth, where they formed five powerful kingdoms. The wisest of them, a king named Solomon, was known to have mysterious powers connections to the 72 most powerful demons...

Years have passed, and demons attack human kingdoms. A young warrior named Shellstein is told to learn the truth about the legacy of Solomon, which is the key to defeating the demons...

Wolfish Gallop: Legacy of the Solomon is a RPG with strong elements of a strategy game. The player is able to move on a linear world map, as well as visit towns and dungeon-like areas; player-controlled characters participate in turn-based combat against various enemies, in traditional Japanese RPG style. Like in strategy games, the player can control multiple parties of characters, which can form army units. Different characters take the role of main heroes during the game (Chapter One begins with the king Duran seeking help against demonic invaders), and, beside "important" story-related characters, simple soldiers can also be recruited and participate in battles.

sample_screenshots.caption: Bartender!.. Hic!!.. Gimme... a mug o' beer!..

title: Wolfish Gallop: Legacy of the Solomon

description:
Riku is a knight of the Yūrō Empire, part of a medieval fantasy world known as Varcias. One day, returning to Yūrō through the desert, Riku found a girl lying nearly unconscious on the sand. This girl is revealed to be Azusa, a modern-day Japanese schoolgirl who, thanks to a time warp, ended up in Varcias. Riku must now help Azusa return to her home world. But enemy forces are attacking Yūrō, and the Empress is in desperate need of assistance.

Yūrō: Transient Sands is an action RPG. The player controls Riku, manipulating him through vast hostile environments, returning to the town to rest and buy better weapons, armor, and healing items. Like in Ys games, Riku dispatches of his enemies simply by running into them. Accumulated experience points eventually raise Riku's levels, making him stronger. The game features explicit sexual scenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Elven forest on a sea shore
The... erm... hotel employee provides some... ahem!.. services

title: Yūrō: Transient Sands

description:
Feti is a short game that doesn't have a real plot; its entire text is a conversation between two "office ladies" (sometimes shortened in Japanese language usage to "OL"), Eri and Kazumi. They chat mostly about men, clothes, and sex. The conversation develops, until the two young women begin to get intimate with each other.

The game starts with both Eri and Kazumi wearing clothes, and they gradually undress as the game progresses. A special attention is paid to the variety of lingerie both women wear. The player's input is confined to decision-making; giving different answers to the girls' questions to unlock different portions of text and new pictures. There is also a cursor shaped like an eye that the player can periodically use, but it serves mostly to click on the visible body part and advance the conversation.

sample_screenshots.caption: You even have scenes with shoes
Now, this is what I call "close up"!

title: Feti

description:
In File, the player takes the role of young man named Pat, who is working for a powerful state security organization in an unspecified English-speaking country. His boss, a mysterious high-ranked agent named Cropp, tells him about a strictly classified project under the codename IBIS, which was intended as a counter-terror measure. Four young women have been apprehended under suspicious circumstances (amnesia following an accident, proximity to weapon research facility, etc.). Pat's task is to interrogate those women and to find out the truth about their activities.

In the beginning of the game the protagonist is shown all the four dossiers, and the player can choose to play the four interrogations in any order. The game has a typical Japanese-adventure interface with verb commands ("Look", "Talk", "Think") and some specific commands during particular situations. The game advances through continuous usage of these commands.

The interrogation of the girls always leads to sexual situations - consensual or not. The game has scenes with explicit sexual content.
title: File

description:
Unlike the first Idol Project, the story of the sequel is directly related to to the anime series Idol Project, starring the same characters, with the young and ambitious Mimu Emilton as the protagonist. Mimu finds herself on a tropical island, where she must rise to fame by winning contests and promoting her singing skills. Like in the previous game, the majority of gameplay is dedicated to exploring the top-down city, visiting various places, searching for necessary people and raising the protagonist's parameters. Mimu has a much more detailed set of parameters than the hero of the previous game, including physical attributes as well as popularity rankings. The RPG element has been further enhanced by introducing random character (crazed fans and alike) who would sometimes attack Mimu on the city map and other locations.

Like the anime, Idol Project 2 has somewhat sexy, but "cute" graphics, as opposed to the adult overtones of the predecessor.
title: Idol Project 2

description:
The story of Pero-Pero Candy: Yō no Shō is very simple: the protagonist is a modern-day young man who accidentally finds a very special shop named "Mink" (by sheer coincidence, sharing its name with the company that made this game). Basically, it is a brothel, but one that has only one employee - a girl named Candy, who is ready to help the customer realize his erotic fantasies.

The game can be considered a "sexual role-playing simulation"; the only objective in the game is to reach 100% "pleasure meter" for the protagonist, by trying out all possible combinations of places, costumes, roles, positions, etc., unlocking the CGs in the process. The player is able to choose a location (school, hospital, etc.), a role for Candy (obedient house wife, scared school girl, etc.), as well as a variety of sexual positions. Once everything is selected, the scene plays automatically. Afterwards, the player is brought back to Mink, where he can continue to try out other combinations.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...when I appeared, wearing a BEAR COSTUME!
Nah, I'm not sick at all

title: Pero-Pero Candy: Yō no Shō

description:
In the 1990-ies, increased tension between powerful countries of the world and economic crisis have eventually lead to open hostility. By 2018, the world was nearly destroyed in a devastated war. A handful of scientists working for peace have devised a plan - called "Project ZX" - to prevent this disaster from happening. All they need are a dozen of young, pretty girls, who would be trained with the newest scientific equipment. The hero of the game is a lazy teenager, fan of computers and - surprise! - pretty girls, and he is the one who is entrusted by an old scientist to find and recruit these special girls, aided by a robotic bird named Chico.

Bishoujo Hunter ZX is a text-heavy Japanese-style adventure. The game world is composed of still screens, which offer interaction in form of menu-based verb commands. Typically for the genre, events are often triggered by going through most or all the commands at any given screen.
title: Bishōjo Hunter ZX

description:
An oligarch named Takanashi has built a prestigious girl's high school, known as the Hanatsuki High. Mishima, a young man who has recently graduated high school, is approached by Isao, representative of the Hanatsuki High and his former schoolmate, with a part-time teaching job offer. Despite his dislike to certain school policies Mishima agrees - first, because he is broke, and second, because the perspective to teach the pretty daughters of the wealthiest people in Japan doesn't seem all that unpleasant...

Figure: Ubawareta Hōkago is mostly composed of text descriptions and dialogues accompanied by pictures. The game advances automatically, occasionally pausing to prompt the player to make a decision, which can be a choice of a location to visit, a dialogue choice, or an action choice. The game features a branching story-line with several endings.
title: Figure: Ubawareta Hōkago

description:
Machida Haruko, nicknamed "Faru", is a young girl who was living together with her sister Mei. Mei has mysteriously disappeared, and one day Faru received a package, which contained a video showing her sister, tortured by unknown people, crying in agony. The young heroine heads to the high school Mei studied in. She tries to get a job there, in order to investigate the circumstances of her sister's disappearance, and bring her home safe...

Fuzoroi no Lemon has characteristics of a Japanese-style adventure, having no puzzles and relying on visiting places randomly to trigger events in order to advance the story. However, unlike most Japanese adventures, the game plays from a top-down perspective, allowing physical movement around the game world. Most of the gameplay is dedicated to walking around, finding important people and talking to them. Some of the dialogues have multiple conversation topics. The game has its own clock, which is advanced when the heroine visits different locations. Some of the events (such as lessons, beginning and end of work time, certain people being inc certain places, etc.) depend on this inner schedule, the goal sometimes becoming to catch the right person at the right time and place.

The game has scenes with explicit sexual content.
title: Fuzoroi no Lemon

description:
The story of Etemible: Tenjō Mukyū is based on Japanese mythology. The goddess Amaterasu hands an ancient sword to a young female warrior named Himiko, and requests her to save Takamagahara, the dwelling of Japanese gods, from the rampage of her chaotic brother Susanoo and his army of demons.

Etemible: Tenjō Mukyū is a real-time strategy game. Each stage is a large-scale battle, during which the player controls several army units, each led by a "general" (Himiko or others). Both enemy and player-controlled units are moving across the map in real time. Whenever two opposing units meet each other, a battle ensues. The player has no control over it - the outcome is decided by the units' parameters, the health of their soldiers, strength and weaknesses, formation strategy the player chose before the battle, etc. The player can choose whether to watch the battle (displayed on a separate screen) or skip it. The interface is window-based, with different windows depicting characters, their parameters, mini-map, and a zoomed-in area of the player's choice.

sample_screenshots.caption: Don't cast snow on me! That's... not nice

title: Etemible:  Tenjō Mukyū

description:
Love Phantom is a story about Akira Izayoi, a healer with supernatural powers, able to cure curses and demonic diseases, who also happens to be a big admirer of the opposite sex. This time, he finds out that the spirit of Lucretia, a French witch from 16th century, still exists, and must find and deal with it, aided by his pretty assistant and (also pretty) female witches, before an evil demonic organization beats him to it.

Love Phantom consists of a large amount of text accompanied by still pictures (mostly of sexual content). From time to time, the player is able to make a choice, which would change the following dialogue and unlock (or lock) CGs rather than alter the course of the story.

sample_screenshots.caption: A meeting with a cute worker

title: Love Phantom

description:
In Madoll, the player controls a young man named Kazuya. Little is known about his background and past, and it seems like his entire life is dedicated to women. But his relatively peaceful existence comes to end when one day he notices a strange girl in the crowd... a girl who looks and moves as if she were an artificial creature. From that moment on the hero is involved in a bizarre story, during which he will have to understand himself and the world surrounding him...

Madoll mostly describes the numerous encounters (and relationships) between the protagonist and various female characters. The game has no interaction except occasional decision-making; however, these decisions usually alter the course of the story significantly, putting Kazuya's relationships on different paths, and eventually leading to different endings to the story.
title: Madoll

description:
Kumi is an ordinary Japanese teenage girl. At least she was ordinary until one day, walking back home, she spotted a shiny object falling from the sky into a nearby forest. Upon examining the object more closely, Kumi found a cute rabbit-like creature, who called himself Popp claimed to have come from a magical world. Popp granted Kumi the magical ability of shape-shifting: turning into an adult male of her choice... an ability Kumi will need in order to fulfill her mission: sexually satisfy female students and teachers from her high school...

Majokko Kumi is a traditional Japanese adventure game, without puzzle and with menu-based verb "Look- Talk - Think - Move" interaction. Story progression is linear. Most of the game is dedicated to depleting all available options until the game takes the player to a new screen. Sex scenes also feature a point-and-click mouse interface, with a single cursor for all the actions.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hmm, now I must become him...

title: Magical Story Series: Majokko Kumi

description:
The second Magical Story Series game is not connected to the predecessor story-wise, but has a similar premise. The heroine this time is a little girl named Rina, who has a crush on an older boy, whose name is Tatsuya. One night she sees a falling star and wishes to be a grown-up young woman. Miraculously, her wish is fulfilled; but the falling star is revealed to contain a mischievous imp, who grants Rina an ability to grow up and return to her normal self, as well as assume the appearance of other people...

Like the first game, Rina plays like a typical Japanese adventure, with a "Look-Talk-Think-Move" command menu, no puzzles, and the standard requirement to "trigger" new commands by going through all the available ones, often more than one time.

Unlike Kumi, Rina cannot qualify as an adult game. There are implicit erotic situations and innuendo, but no explicit nudity or scenes with sexual content.

sample_screenshots.caption: Intro: oh, handsome boy with another girl...

title: Magical Story Series Part 2: Mahō Shōjo Rina

description: Despite the title (which means Mahjong: Legend of a King), this game doesn't include any story, and is entirely dedicated to playing a board game with mahjong matches against a computer AI-controlled opponent. The main portion of the gameplay takes place on a top-down board, divided into squares. The player has to press a key to stop the rotation of numbers, which are equivalent to a dice roll. The number indicates the amount of squares the player can advance. As in most games of this kind, different squares can have a beneficial or damaging effect on the player's progress. Certain squares marked "Item" allow the player to buy items, which can give him advantage during mahjong parties or movement on the board. Most of the squares lead to a mahjong game against computer AI. If the player fails to beat the opponent in three rounds, it's Game Over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Haven't expected such a Continue screen...

title: Mahjong Ō Densetsu

description:
In Mahjong Princess, the player controls the titular character, a teenage girl named Chiruru Kawai, who has only two passions in her life: mahjong and sex. Those two are also the reasons for her taking part in a mahjong championship, where she competes against the toughest (and prettiest) mahjong ladies. The defeated party agrees to have sex with the winner... on her conditions.

The player selects one of the available eight mahjong opponents, most of which (with one or perhaps two exceptions) are pretty girls. Each player starts with 25000 points. If Chiruru runs out of points, it's Game Over; a victory over the princess' opponent leads to an explicit sex scene.

sample_screenshots.caption: I think somebody here has to raise his English spelling LEBEL :)
...But I won after all!  Let's see exactly how... pant, pant... INTELLECTUAL you are...

title: Mahjong Princess Go! Go!: Chiruru the Mahjong Princess

description:
Mahjong Sangokushi Engi re-creates the events of the classic Chinese Three Kingdoms story - the end of Han Dynasty reign (3rd century AD), and the civil war that erupted as a result and soon spread over the entire country.

What sets this game apart from other strategy games based on the story of Three Kingdoms is the fact everything in it is done according to the rules of the Chinese board game mahjong. Actions like assigning generals, preparing armies, choosing provinces to conquer, etc., follow a traditional turn-based strategy template. However, the strength of the generals, soldiers, etc. is measured by points calculated in mahjong games, with mahjong stones representing various types of military forces. Every confrontation with the enemy is a game of mahjong; it can be set on auto, and the outcome will be decided depending on the player's preparation for the battle.

sample_screenshots.caption: The poor Mob (limit for player name is three characters, so I couldn't make him MOBY) plays mahjong with the distinguished Chinese Sima family...

title: Mahjong Sangokushi Engi

description:
Based on the anime Creamy Mami, the Magic Angel. The original tells the story of a 10-year-old girl named Yuu Morisawa, who gains a magical ability to transform into a grown-up young woman, eventually becoming a pop star and acquainting the inhabitants of the Earth with the rest of the galaxy. Yuu appears in the game, but is not the protagonist; the player controls four young women in four different scenarios: two of them, Yuri and Aya, on the Earth, and the other two, Ora and Sita, in an alien world, mixture of sci-fi and medieval fantasy. The story goes beyond the original anime by introducing a magical, sacred land known as Finality, populated by fantasy being, and calling the guardians (the four girl protagonist) to bring peace to the galaxy.

Futatsu no Sekai plays automatically for the most part, except key scenes which allow interaction - two, sometimes more choices that have to be done by the player. In many cases these choices are merely cosmetic, or may lead to a different text description and scene.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ora and Sita travel to medieval environment

title: Mahō no Tenshi Creamy Mami: Futatsu No Sekai

description:
B-Ko is a princess from a magical dimension, who is having a vacation on the earth, masquerading as a student in the Catholic St. Rapahel High School. This peaceful (and pleasant) time-passing ends when the evil witch Saprinu appears in our dimension and attacks B-Ko. Saprinu's demonic plan is to steal precious energy from female virgins. Now it's time for B-Ko's faithful servant, a young man known as Alpha, to "intercept" the poor virgins (using his own methods), before they fall prey to Saprinu...

Mahō Shōjo B-Ko walks a fine line between an adventure game (Japanese-style) and visual novel; the interaction is very limited, with only three commands (Look, Talk, Move) and no sub-menus. It also features navigation (menu-based) through various parts of the school. Some conversations offer dialogue choices, typically for visual novels.

sample_screenshots.caption: The princess is sleeping... with a naked breast outside...

title: Mahō Shōjo B-Ko

description:
Majoriko was just an ordinary teenage school girl, but her friendship with Sawansa, the daughter of a well-known witch, eventually opened a new magical world for her. Here is how it happened: one day, Sawansa's teacher was conducting a magical experiment. While the teacher was absent, Sawansa recklessly jumped into the mirror, and was sucked into a magical parallel dimension controlled by an evil warlock. Naturally, Majoriko has no choice but to follow her...

Majoriko: Inbikai is a platformer that features the typical jumping and enemy-killing activities, but also usage of magical spells. Majority attacks by firing projectiles with her staff. She can collect coins, which can be used to buy magical items and shop. Many levels require collecting keys or other important items in order to advance. There are also boss battles at the end of most levels.

Majoriko loses parts of her clothes when attacked, and becomes completely naked when defeated by an enemy.
title: Majoriko: Inbikai

description:
In 1999, a global computer network was assembled, allowing unprecedented transportation speed to different locations on the Earth through virtual reality. But it also opened virtual portals to another dimensions. The ruler of one of them, the magical empire Lemuria, concocted a plan to use the computer's energy in order to destroy the Earth. Luckily, not everyone in Lemuria shared his views, including a beautiful girl named Lares, who contacted a group of computer-loving high-school girls in Japan, and turned them into super-heroines who fight in cyberspace!

The game is a turn-based strategy/RPG hybrid, a popular sub-genre among Japanese games. As in most games of this kind, extensive cut-scenes lead to long strategic battles, which take place on a top-down screen and allow turn-based navigation of the characters. The all-female player-controlled party can execute punches and kicks when enemy is in range, as well as magic spells.

When certain enemy characters (also female) or player-controlled characters die, a nude picture of said character is displayed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Let's grab something quick to eat
Communists of all countries, unite? Something like this...

title: Dennō Sentai: Lavian Three

description:
Marginal Storys (sic) is composed of two short visual novels, which are accessible from the main menu and are not related to each other story-wise.

The first one, entitled Forbidden Rhythm, is a bizarre horror story. The protagonist, a young man named Kyouichi, finds himself in an old mansion, which seems to contain an evil energy - dead bodies, ghosts, apparitions haunt Kyouichi, who has to recall childhood events and the incestuous feelings towards his sister.

The second story is named Cosplaytor II (sic), and is set in Tokyo, in 2019. Entertainment as we know it has disappeared off the face of the Earth, replaced by a global virtual reality game, that became the ultimate reality for many people. The player controls an agent known only by his codename ("Z"), who has to investigate criminal occurrences that might lead to a world-wide cyber-conspiracy.

Both stories have the same kind of gameplay, which is closer to a visual novel than to "real" Japanese adventure. There are command menus, but they are context-related and resemble more choices of a visual novel that adventure game interaction. Some choices might lead to a Game Over.

sample_screenshots.caption: It's time to decide what to do with her...
Creepy images right from the start

title: Marginal Storys

description:
Keiichi Hayama is an ordinary Japanese high-school student, who has lost his parents and lives together with his foster mother and her daughter, which he considers his own sister - or so he thought... Because all the boy can think about is sex, and the two women he lives with are both very pretty, not blood-related to him, and also sex-hungry. To make things even worse, an exceedingly well-endowed exchange student comes to live with them. In short, what follows is a series of increasingly erotic encounters, which pretty much sum up the plot of the game.

Mashō no Kao is a Japanese-style adventure, with "Look - Search - Talk - Other" command pattern (special commands are added to the menu depending on the context). There isn't much interaction or exploration; the game follows a day-by-day template, with Keiichi automatically attending classes, returning home, etc.

sample_screenshots.caption: You spy on the exchange student while she is taking shower...
...and neither is your foster mother... only she prefers... err... vegetables? Make no mistake, this game IS pretty sick

title: Mashō no Kao

description:
In Metamorph Meena, the player controls Mai, a little girl who has a crush on an older boy who, naturally, doesn't pay any attention to her. But one day she meets too imp-like creatures, one of whom is Pal, the 153rd prince of a magical world called Dream Star, and the other his court magician Pul. The two turn Mai into an adult young woman and she begins to explore her newly found sexuality...

This is a Japanese adventure game with linear story progression. The interaction consists mainly of small command menus, until the heroine becomes intimate with another character. At such times, the interface changes to sexual commands (touch, lick, etc.), which lead to a point-and-click interaction with the partner's body; often the player then assumes the role of Mai's partner, with Mai herself becoming the "object".

sample_screenshots.caption: First you control mai's new girlfriend and do stuff with Mai...

title: Metamorph Meena

description:
Long time ago, the Magic World and our world were not on good terms. But now, it has become different - or has it?.. In any case, a young spoiled boy named Frito, from a rich Magic World family, has to get married - and his father tells him to choose a spouse from our world. Frito's trusted servant, an elf-like creature named Fin, finds three suitable girls: a Japanese high-school student (naturally), a maid, and a Wild West farmer girl. Who will become the happy bride?..

Mischif (sic) is a Japanese adventure, with verb commands ("Look", "Talk", "Think", etc.), which usually have to be depleted to advance the story. It is possible to "tackle" the girls in any order. Once the player character becomes intimate with a girl, the game switches to a point-and-click interface with a variety of sexual commands. It is also possible to die in the game by selecting the wrong command in certain situations.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...now I'm pretty sure she does! Selecting the "hand" cursor

title: Mischif

description:
In the end of 21st century, a devastating war destroyed most of human civilization. Thousand years have passed since. The humans had to re-build their civilization, and religion played an important part in the new world. A new religion, which claimed to be "the faith of love", began to spread through the world. Joe, a young and enthusiastic female knight and preacher, heads to a remote village in order to convert the non-believers to the new religion. But will her own faith be challenged when she discovers the truth about our world?..

Mission is a Japanese-style RPG, with most characteristic ingredients such as top-down world map navigation, linear story, simple combat mechanics, automatic leveling up, etc. Unlike most Japanese RPGs of the time, the enemies are visible walking on the world map and in dungeons; contact with enemies initiates a battle. A somewhat unusual feature is the necessity to choose participants (both enemy and player-controlled) before every battle, which then turns into a one-on-one turn-based fight.

sample_screenshots.caption: This guy is hit by my robotic fighter

title: Mission

description:
The game is based on the manga series Moryou Senki Madara. The story is set in a mythological era in Japan, and focuses on twin brothers, Madara and Kage-Ou ("Shadow King"), sons of the evil Emperor Miroku. While Kage-Ou follows in the footsteps of his father, Madara fights against him and for the good of mankind. The game begins as Madara is gravely wounded in his fight against Miroku, but is saved by a young warrior named Seishinja, who lives together with his sister Himika. Before Madara is cured, Seishinja has to fight demons himself, with the help of the legendary sword Kusanagi.

The game has traditional Japanese RPG ingredients, such as a linear story, turn-based combat, and automatic leveling. The interface, however, is different than in most RPGs, having an adventure-like menu with icon commands. The player advances in the game by traveling to different locations (still via the command menu), and battles are pre-set, dictated by the story. Beside regular attacking, many special martial moves and magic can be used.

sample_screenshots.caption: Cute animals = bad guys. Sometimes it is like that - in a Japanese game

title: Mōryō Senki Madara: Daikongō Rinhen

description:
Once upon a time, there was a young boy who loved motorcycles. Riding through the night on his bike was what he enjoyed most - until one night he crashed into a car, and was taken to hospital. There, he wakes up to find out that he'll have to go through some injections and infusions, which scares him so much that he faints... and immediately finds himself mysterious transported to a bizarre magical realm, somewhat inspired by Alice in Wonderland, with well-dressed rabbits, smoking caterpillars, but also plenty of cute girls. It turns out that this Wonderland isn't that bad - but how hard will it be to conquer the hearts of its pretty inhabitants?..

Night Shifter is an adventure game. Although it was made by a Japanese company, it has elements of a Western adventure. The gameplay emphasizes exploration and conversation choices. The hero can move through top-down locations. When he reaches a place of interest, the perspective switches to first-person, displaying menu-based commands.

A stand-out feature of the game is the possibility to play it in either Lawful or Chaotic ways. Most of the locations in the two play modes overlap, but the starting locations and many events are completely different. The player can choose Lawful or Chaotic path from the main menu; it is impossible to change it afterwards.
title: Night Shifter

description:
Noltia contains three scenarios, which are not related to each other story-wise. All the three share traditional Japanese adventure gameplay, with "Look - Talk - Think" verb command pattern, no inventory, no puzzles, and plenty of text.

The first one can be played as either of its two main characters - the boy Aruto or the girl Kyoko. Both are not what they seem to be: Aruto is working for a registry organization in the World of the Dead, and he has to bring Kyoko to judgment, where it will be decided whether she goes to heaven or hell after death. However, Kyoko is actually an angel, whose goal is to save Aruto from killing himself. Both characters have special bars - the well-being of the protagonist and the proximity of the opponent to the protagonist's goal. Command choices can increase or decrease either of these statistics. Wrong choices can lead to Game Over.

The second scenario casts the player in the role of a high-school student named Yoshihiko, who is hired by a gym teacher to take erotic pictures of high-school girls and bring them to him. This scenario allows movement through school locations (menu command "Move"), and, depending on the player's choices, Yoshihiko can succeed in taking the most erotically satisfying pictures, or achieve one of the "bad" endings.

The third scenario is a realistic depiction of a relationship between a young man named Eiji and his little sister Miwa. The player can choose to play as either one of them. Eiji is dating Miwa's schoolmate, and Miwa tries to understand the change in her own feelings. In this episode, the gameplay is rather straight-forward Japanese adventure.

sample_screenshots.caption: How boring, how boring, blah, blah, blah...
The weird "hellish" scenario begins... in an amusement park

title: Noltia

description:
In Panic Dolls, three ordinary Japanese school girls suddenly discover that Miki, their school nurse, is in fact a "Master Dragoon", a super-heroine fighting for a powerful galactic organization. Their current adversary is the evil warlord Barado and his emissary, the sexy yet deadly monster-summoner Kyuuma. The three girls turn into the super-heroines Phoenix Rose, Tiger Lily, and Tortoise Cheery - the Power Dolls - and venture into Barado's dungeons to defeat him once and for all...

...only the player won't be helping them. In a sudden twist, the player is given control of the evil Kyuuma. The girls are automatically walking through the isometric, maze-like dungeons, trying to find the exit. The player's goal is to help Kyuuma summon monsters to stop them. As the girls walk, their attack level increases (from 0 to 4), and so does Kyuuma's summoning level. At level 4, she can summon the most powerful monsters in each category (giants, demons, spirits, etc.). When the monster is placed into the dungeon, it will try to find its way to the girls. Depending on the girls' level and the monster's level, the battle will decrease the girls' level by a certain number. The trick is to position different monsters in such a way that the girls will have to face a monster when they are all at level 0. Losing a battle at level 0 will cause a girl to become disoriented and wander off, turning into easier prey for the monsters, and eventually getting killed in a battle.

The game doesn't stop if the girls successfully traverse a dungeon. The player can simply let them walk and advance to the next dungeon screen. Depending on where and how the player disposes of the girls, the game ends with a different scene.

The game has cut-scenes with explicit sexual content.

sample_screenshots.caption: Kyuuma does... err. some stuff to Rose
Summoned two monsters. Poor girls, they still don't know what is waiting for them...

title: Panic Dolls

description:
A series of gruesome murders shocks Japan. Young women are kidnapped, tortured, and killed under mysterious circumstances...

The protagonist wakes up in what looks like a hospital, but is in fact a special psychiatric facility on a space station. The hero doesn't remember anything, not even his name. Three young women - Shelly, Elisa, and Aoka - will help him to find his memory, and he will gradually realize who he is and what is his mission.

Persona: Ingyaku no Kamen can be considered a visual novel, since the only input done by the player throughout the game is a choice which girl to visit. The rest of the game consists of dialogues and cut-scenes (many of which have sexual content). Depending on where the hero goes, and at what moment, the game takes a step towards one of the several endings, most of which are considered "bad". To facilitate the player's efforts to reach the best ending, he is given a set of statistics, which will be raised or lowered, indicating how close he is to full success.
title: Persona: Ingyaku no Kamen

description:
Tetsuya is a rather ordinary Japanese teenager, who prefers hanging out with his sweetheart Rika than going to school. His passion are 3D video games. The newest game machine which allows the player to completely submerge into the virtual world, modeled according to his desires, has captured his heart. But one thing is strange: lately, Tetsuya keeps seeing himself as a killer and rapist. Dreams begin to haunt him. Is this just a side-effect of the game, or does he have a dark side he knows nothing about? Or maybe the game took him to another world, which will from now on become part of his life?..

The larger portion of Power Slave plays like a Japanese adventure, most of the gameplay being dedicated to choosing locations from the town map, triggering events and advancing the story. The omnipresent "Look - Talk - Move" menu appears at some locations. However, there are also several turn-based battles in the game. Those battles are always story-related, take place on an isometric screen, and are fought against a single enemy. Tetsuya can attack physically, defend, or spend two turns concentrating his spiritual energy in order to execute a special attack. The key to winning the battles lies in predicting the opponent's move, which can be deduced from their dialogue lines.

Power Slave has explicit sex scenes. Unlike in most other similar games, many of them are animated, using 2D anime-style graphics.

sample_screenshots.caption: Who is she? Who am I?..
Get away from my sister, brute!

title: Power Slave

description:
In this game, the player takes control of Akira Tadokoro, a 17-year-old exchange student. He attends the new school for one year only, because of his father's job. Afterwards, he'll have to go back - so there is no time to lose! The boy must do something about all those pretty girls in his school. But in order to capture their hearts, he will have to know them better...

Pure is a Japanese-style adventure game that takes place entirely in the school. At each location of the school (classroom, tennis court, etc.), the player is given the same menu of commands, which are Look, Talk, Ask, Show, Move, Search, Use, and Give. Each of these commands list to a sub-menu of selectable objects; the last two deal with inventory items the player might obtain. There are no real puzzles, but at certain points the player has to do more than just try to trigger the next scene - asking the right question or showing the right item might do the trick.
title: Pure

description:
The situation at the high-school soccer club is not good, and the coach is even afraid of getting fired... that's where the hero of the game, a student named Kitayama, steps into the picture. The coach asks him to become a "beauty manager", to search out pretty girls and to convince them participate in club activities. Kitayama is aided by two other schoolmates, but the player has to do the job all by himself...

The game plays similarly to its predecessor, with its Japanese adventure-style gameplay, high school setting, and the same menu commands at each location. There are no item-related commands, however, but some new ones, such as "Touch".
title: Pure II

description:
Shimeji attends the Touyama High School. She has a best friend there, is successful in studies, and also has a part-time job as a waitress. Yet she is not happy. One day, her friends find her on the floor, unconscious. They bring her to the young school doctor, who also happens to be the protagonist of this game. The hero is impressed by Shimeji's beauty, but he is also determined to find the cause of her depression. Piece by piece he uncovers the truth about Shimeji's life...

The game is composed mainly of text accompanied by pictures. Movement and most of the actions are done automatically by the game. Sometimes the player has to choose an action from two or more available ones, but often only one choice advances the game. There are also a few parts with point-and-click interface, when the hero examines Shimeji.

sample_screenshots.caption: Shimeji is raped by her boss

title: 5 Jikan me no Venus

description: 48 Night Story has, despite its name, no story (on the game's title screen, the number "8" is written by combining the international signs for "male" and "female"...). The game is entirely dedicated to sex and can be therefore considered a sex simulation. There are 48 young girls to choose from. Each of them has a name and a short biography, including likes and dislikes, sexual experience, etc. After choosing a girl, the game has to match her portrait by clicking on one of the four cards hiding pictures of different girls. Then the player goes through the girl's bio, asking a limited amount of questions. Then it is time to choose one of the many available sexual positions, trying to choose the one the girl would be most comfortable with, according to her data known to the player. The actual sex scene proceeds then automatically.

sample_screenshots.caption: The amount of positions is mind-boggling
Only one girl of the third set left!..

title: 48 Night Story

description:
The protagonist of this game is a young man from a rich family, who has lost his parents when he was a child. Lately, he has been haunted by nightmares, in which objects of his sexual desires were appearing to him in dark, demonic forms. Using his money and influence, he captures the female students of the St. Excellent Girls High School, with only one goal in mind - rape them.

Akumu can be considered a "rape simulator", since most of the game consists of picking one of the many available girls and then going through menu commands, most of which are dedicated to precise sexual choices.

sample_screenshots.caption: All the girls are here. Choose your victim...
One of the few hentai games that actually warns you before you play it... it even has a warning against masturbation :)
Forcing her to suck MOSAICS must be the worst thing

title: Akumu: Aoi Kajitsu no Sanka

description:
Alaskan malamute is actually a dog breed (similar to Siberian husky); but this game has nothing to do with dogs and everything to do with golf. The introduction story tells us that in 1912, the famous American businessman J.P.Morgan founded a golf tournament in Alaska. The best golfers from all over the world came to compete, but nobody from Japan... so naturally, the player has to correct that!

Referring to itself as a "3D simulation golf game", Alaskan Malamute G.C. features pseudo-3D terrain with rotatable camera. The player is able to adjust his golfer's position, strength, direction, and style of the shot. It is possible to create own players with different statistics. The game has various play modes, with up to 4 players competing in each; those modes include regular play, tournament, and training.
title: Alaskan Malamute G.C.

description:
In the miraculous World of Demons, there lived a vampiric count. One day, standing near the statue of the Goddess of Time, the count thought with sadness of everyone's mortal fate; at this moment the God of Death appeared, telling the count he has a visitor in his castle. The visitor turns out to be a succubus named Karuru, who suggests that the count trains two young female demons, Tiris and Emalis, and sends them to the other worlds...

Angel Night has elements of adventure game (verb-based interface, menu-based navigation through the game world, usage of inventory items, etc.), visual novel (choosing answers that will influence the course of the story), as well as simulation game elements. The simulation aspect is evident in the statistics the two young girls have: depending on the count's actions, they will have better or worse training, and also might have a sexual relationship with their master.
title: Angel Night

description:
The peaceful rural people known as "Monzetsu" (the word also means "anguish") have a legend that tells of a cruel king who had extreme sexual powers. His name has become taboo, but now, 300 years later, he is reincarnated. The best female fighters of the country must fight each other, proving their proficiency in sex, in order to face the king as the final confrontation!

Monzetsu Fighter looks like a fighting game: it has a story mode and a battle mode, both of which consist of one-on-one fights. However, the fights themselves are strictly card-based. A rather unique feature of the game is the sexual nature of the fights. Each card depicts a certain sexual action. Every character has strength and weaknesses to different sexual techniques, so in order to win, the player must choose the right cards to play. Identical cards can be used in combos, dealing greater "damage". Playing a card leads to a sexually explicit, animated short scene depicting the action in question.
title: Monzetsu Fighter

description:
After the events of Animahjong V3, the protagonist of that game is now close friends with the three mahjong-playing sisters. One day while walking home from school the youngest sister Rumi is kidnapped and the player must search for clues that will reunite the family. Playing the role of the male protagonist or either of Rumi's older sisters, Yumika and Miyabi, you compete against several female mahjong players who might have information on Rumi's whereabouts.

After each successful mahjong round, the girl who lost removes an item of her clothes. As in other games by Sogna, the undressing sequences are fully animated.

sample_screenshots.caption: So now the character you picked (in this case Miyabi) needs to strip
Game Over - kicked to the curb

title: Animahjong X

description:
Anniversary: Memories of Summer Vacation tells the story of a young girl named Ringo. One night, Ringo witnesses an impish girl named Cherry seducing another girl. At first she feels repulsed, but after a while finds out that she is excited... soon she and Cherry become lovers and soulmates, unaware of the fact that Cherry is being hunted by the authorities...

The game is a traditional Japanese-style adventure (without puzzles). Interaction with the game world is performed by selected verb commands (Look, Talk, Think, Move, etc.), from a menu. Selecting a command leads to context-related sub-menus.

Sex scenes are handled somewhat differently; also with verb commands, but rather concrete ones (Touch, Lick, etc.), and point-and-click interaction instead of sub-menus.
title: Anniversary: Memories of Summer Vacation

description:
The heroine of this curiously named title is Choko, the princess of the fictional country Baskin, which is mostly a medieval world with some modern-day anachronisms. She lives in the capital city Robins with her Mom and Dad, namely queen and king. Her curious nature eventually leads her to some interesting acquaintances, including magic users and adventurers, who help her to uncover a threat to her family and country. The princess has to travel through a dangerous forest with her best buddy Meron, in order to protect Baskin from danger.

31... is a Japanese-style adventure game. The interaction is minimal, usually restricted to two or three commands (mostly Look or Talk) with a few sub-menus at most. Usually, the player advances the story and proceeds automatically when all the options at the screen are depleted. However, there is also menu-based navigation (in the forest, etc.), which requires memorizing ways and choosing directions correctly.

The game contains scenes with nudity and sexual situations.
title: 31: Iwayuru Hitotsu no Chō Lovely na Bōken Katsugeki

description:
Battle Queen is all about fights between beautiful young women. In the beginning of the game the player is given the option to choose one of the three available fighters. Each one has an introduction story. Sayaka witnesses the murder of her father, a circus acrobat, by a witch known as Lavender; her story begins with a fight against her. Mai's and Mercedes' stories are one and the same; they are fighting for dominance in modern-day Japan, and fight each other in the first round of their stories.

Despite looking like a fighting game, Battle Queen is strategy-, not action-oriented. The fights are turn-based. The player can choose between different moves, including four kinds of attack, jump, defend, special attacks, etc. Special attacks can only be executed after performing a sufficient amount of other moves.

Each move is displayed as an anime-style image. The girls lose parts of their clothes when being hit. Defeating the opponent results in a sex scene.

sample_screenshots.caption: Chioosing one of the initial three fighters

title: Battle Queen: Saikyō Fighters Retsuden

description:
Monstrous aliens are attacking a skyscraper area in a modern city on the Earth. A special battleship, navigated by captain Eve Bloodymary and second-in-command Rose Daiquiri, is sent to deal with the threat. At the same time, the protagonist of the game awakens in a dark room. He remembers nothing but his name (default: Kojuurou), and a short scene: skyscraper, an alien approaching - darkness... Before long he meets a mysterious girl named Ren, who for some reason calls him "Master"... Is this a new threat to the human race? Or is Kojuurou's own nature changing?...

Be-Yond is a Japanese-style adventure with an icon-based interface. At every given screen,m there is a set of commands: Look, Talk, Think, Discuss, and Go (sometimes with sub-menus). Usually, the story advances when all of the commands have been used several times. At certain points there are also dialogue options and choices of action. The game features nudity and sexual content.
title: Be-Yond: Kurodaishō ni Mirareteru

description: Birthdays is a dating simulation game. The goal of the game is to successfully date a girl of the player's choice. The player first chooses a birthday and a name for his alter ego. Then he is presented with a calendar for the year. Visiting different locations (movies, shopping mall, etc.) leads to meetings with different girls. After learning their phone numbers, it becomes possible to call them and set a date. During dates, the player often has to choose between different dialogue lines to please the girl. It is also possible to buy present for the ladies. It is entirely possible to set dates with multiple girls, but they might meet each other and become jealous. Girls also don't take it lightly if you don't appear on a date. Finally, at the protagonist's next birthday, the most impressed girl will agree to have sex with him. The sex scenes are explicit, but rather few.
title: Birthdays

description: Valentine Kiss is a dating simulation game, very similar to Birthdays, only instead of "conquering" a girl as a birthday present, the goal here is to "score" on Valentine's Day. The actual gameplay is nearly identical to that of Birthdays, with a few interface changes and minor tweaks (for example, the game pauses automatically to remind the player of his alter ego's date). There are only four girls here, and the protagonist meets them right at the beginning, as opposed to Birthdays, where there were eight different girls met at different locations. There are, however, more detailed conversations with the girls, and some new choices during dates (such as holding hands, etc.). There are explicit sex scenes, but they only appear during the game's endings.

sample_screenshots.caption: Picking up a girl at her school

title: Birthdays 2: Valentine Kiss

description:
A young man named Shounosuke sees a strange dream: a voice talks about mankind and its sins, and a beautiful girl begs him to save her... The next day, when he goes to school, an earthquake occurs, and he is miraculously taken into another world, where he meets the girl from his dreams. She says that girls in different dimensions are in grave danger, and Shounosuke has to save them...

Bomber Quest has elements of both strategy/puzzle game and RPG. Each of the six girls has a different scenario, accessible from the beginning. Each scenario puts the player character into a top-down environment. Shounosuke has to build a maze to access its locations. The maze is built from small pieces taken from Tetris. The player can rotate the pieces and then place them onto the ground. The goal is to build a maze that would cover possibly large ground, gaining access to important locations and items. Visiting uncovered locations in the right order leads to cut scenes, which advance the plot.
