A girl has eaten an apple and suddenly became tiny. Her boyfriend realizes that was the work of a group of female witches, and embarks on a journey to find them and lift the curse, all the while being confronted by their minions.

Nut Berry is a quiz game with strategy board game elements. The player character moves on a map according to a number randomly resulting from throwing dice. Each location leads to a short quiz proposed by a female character. Answering three questions correctly will win the "battle"; each wrong answer depletes the hero's HP. Special locations such as houses and castles contain young women who undress when the player answers a question correctly.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...and even take some erotic poses for you
Won a battle - the girl is crying :)

title: Nut Berry

description: 101-kaime no Approach Shot is a golf game with erotic scenes. The player can choose to play in the training mode, alternating between five courses of various difficulty, and setting the strike limit. The versus mode allows the player to choose one of the many available female opponents of different appearances and professions (e.g. a schoolgirl, a teacher, a nurse, etc.). The game is played from first-person perspective; the player must stop a moving bar at the right time to regulate the strength of the shot and its angle. Having a lower score after four holes makes the opponent undress and assume an erotic pose.
title: 101-kaime no Approach Shot

description: Zettai Mahjong is a strip mahjong game. Taking part in a major mahjong competition, the player has to face five increasingly skillful young female opponents. Betting rules, handicaps and conditions can be chosen before each game. After each successful round the girl will remove an item of her clothes.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...but you are willing to disregard that :)
Nice picture with a crescent theme
You can have a combination here

title: Zettai Mahjong

description: Zettai Mahjong II' EG is a follow-up to Zettai Mahjong. It follows the same basic principle of competing against young women in the game of strip mahjong. The sequel features only three opponents, as opposed to five of the original game. These opponents are characters from popular games, e.g. Nakoruru from Samurai Shodown. An important difference is the absence of explicit nudity in this installment. The girls never fully remove their underwear, and censorship in form of stars is applied to their tops.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...perhaps because she doesn't know it's not a real strip mahjong!

title: Zettai Mahjong II' EG

description:
Akizuki is an ordinary Japanese man who works in an office. One day his boss asks him to discreetly investigate a case of stolen prospects that could damage the company's reputation. Akizuki must talk to the female co-workers and find out the truth. However, his mind is more occupied with his own personal expectations from these attractive ladies...

OL Sōsamō is a visual novel with adult scenes. The player is sometimes able to choose which location (usually an office room) the protagonist should visit. Dialogues with the female characters often offer two or three choices. Depending on these decisions, the plot may branch in different directions, and the player is able to unlock different scenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Following a woman to her house

title: OL Sōsamō

description:
Space explorers from Earth discovered a strange cosmic object: a giant pumpkin nearing the planet. Upon establishing contact with the pumpkin, they discovered that this vessel belonged to Prince Q from the planet Omega. The planet's super-computer (with a powerful 4 MhZ processor) determined that the prince has to get married. In order to do that, he has to descend onto Earth and find a suitable candidate - naturally after having conducted a thorough sexual examination.

Wakusei Omega no Q Ōji is essentially a visual novel, though with very few plot-branching decisions. Most of the time, when the player is presented with choices, either both of them lead to the same result, or the player can select the correct one without penalty. The short romances with various characters can be completed in any order.

sample_screenshots.caption: I wonder if she likes this construction site

title: Wakusei Omega no Q Ōji

description:
Daisenryaku II is the second main installment in the turn-based war strategy series. Like its predecessor, the game puts the player in the role of a commander of an army that must defeat an opposing force on a given map within a certain amount of turns. The player has to manage unit production, deliver supply vehicles, and navigate infantry, tanks, aircraft and ships on a hex-based grid map, trying to conquer the opponent's cities and strategic locations.

The main new feature of this installment is the introduction of two additional possible belligerents ("green" and "yellow"), along with the old "blue" and "red". Any of the four sides can be assigned to be controlled by either a human player or the computer AI. Many of the maps may feature only two or three sides, but some offer a full-scale war between four armies. A few maps are based on real geographical areas (e.g. Italy), or may allude to a historical conflict, such as the conquests of the Roman Empire; weapons and vehicles, however, are always modern.

sample_screenshots.caption: In this map green is a peaceful, rural nation
Aerial battle between red and yellow
It is important to occupy the bridges, cutting advancement of the enemy
The shore provides additional protection. Looks like nobody will attack from there
Red planes attack a huge green ship!

title: Daisenryaku II

description: Daisenryaku III: Great Commander is a turn-based war strategy game. Like its predecessor, it allows up to four players to compete against each other or computer AI in various war scenarios, controlling armies distinguished by their colors (blue, red, green, and yellow). There are ten maps to choose from, some of which are based on real-world locations and depict historical conflicts, e.g. Russia and Japan fighting over islands in the North Pacific ocean; there are, however, no detailed reconstructions of historical battles, and all sides in all scenarios use the same modern types of weapons and vehicles. The gameplay system remains mostly unchanged compared to the second installment; differences mostly involve larger maps, interface tweaks, different degrees of zooming, etc.
title: Daisenryaku III: Great Commander

description: The protagonist of Lemon Angel is Tomo, a high school student and one of the mahjong opponents in Mahjong Lemon Angel. This game however, has nothing to do with mahjong and plays - despite a rudimentary Japanese-style adventure verb interface - like a very basic visual novel, with right choices advancing the story and wrong ones leading to various Game Over situations. The plot involves Tomo meeting her friends Erika and Miki, only to become trapped in a magical dimension with her friends gone. Tomo must travel to various worlds in order to find them; these worlds have varied themes and settings, including an alien attack on a spaceship, a country populated by giant sexually abusive mushrooms, a realm that changes Tomo's gender, etc. Explicit sexual scenes occupy a large portion of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: This cute-looking mushroom is a rapist. Seriously, I'm not joking...

title: Lemon Angel

description:
Märchen Veil II is the second part of the story that began in Märchen Veil I. The bereaved king of the Lake Country seeks the help of the powerful goddess Lua as he tries to remove the curse that has befallen his son. However, the prince feels it is his duty to defeat the evil wizard responsible for the curse, and he embarks on a journey to gather mysterious artifacts that will help him achieve this goal.

Gameplay-wise, the game is very similar to its predecessor. The prince explores maze-like overhead areas, fighting enemies with ranged magic and power-ups. The sequel expands equipment management, allowing the player to change equipped items at any time.
title: Märchen Veil II

description:
Wakusei Dethperant is the third entry in the Schwarzschild series and the follow-up to Teikoku no Haishin. Human civilization has expanded beyond the Milky Way, but further advancement was made difficult due to the presence of strong, consolidated alien nations beyond the borders of the galaxy. The events of the game take place in the Gardinal star system not far from the Milky Way. The player is cast into the role of Exas Graft, the human ("Earthman", according to the game's terminology) leader of the small Parsian Republic. Eleven nations are present in the region, and Graft must defend his new homeland through skillful diplomacy and military strategy.

The game's basic gameplay rules remain similar to those of the two previous installments. Like before, the focus of the game is on grand strategy — resource management, research, diplomacy, etc., rather than on combat tactics. Like in the preceding games, combat occurs automatically and the player can only choose general commands during his turn. The interface has been revamped, with a much larger viewing area of the star system and no fixed windows for menus. Wakusei Dethperant is more character-oriented than the previous entries in the series, depicting unique alien races and assigning personality traits and distinct visual appearance to each leader and general. The game's visuals also have a more pronounced anime flavor.

sample_screenshots.caption: The most powerful leader in the region talks to you
Hmm.... I hope we have enough money for this

title: Schwarzschild III: Wakusei Dethperant

description: Air Combat II is a first-person flight and air combat simulation. The player can choose between eight missions of various difficulty. The missions have abstract names and are not associated with particular geographical locations, though they may include different types of terrain (desert, grassland, etc.) to fly over. Available aircraft are F-14A, F-15E, F-16C, F/A-18A, YF-22A, YF-23A, TORNADO-IDS, F-117A, JAS39, F-4, MIG-29, Su-27, MIG-21, Rafale A, and MIG-31. Each of these can be outfitted with different weapons. The player can also choose a wingman to assist during the missions.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can view and save the replay

title: Air Combat II

description: This add-on to Air Combat II introduces aircraft types MI-C.A.D.O.III, F-20, A-7, A-10, T-4, FSX, and B-2 in addition to those selectable in the base game. It also contains eight new scenarios, some of which are set in concrete geographical areas. Though the player can select any aircraft for any scenario, some of the scenarios are specifically designed for a particular type of aircraft.

sample_screenshots.caption: 7 new planes: F-20 Tigershark, A-7 Corsair II, A-10 Thunderbolt II, T-4, FSX, B-2 and the fictional MI-C.A.D.O III

title: Air Combat II: Scenario Collection

description: The second add-on to Air Combat II introduces aircraft types MiG-25, Su-27K, Su-37, Shinden, F-86, MiG-15, F-4, MiG-21, Mirage III and Super Étendard in addition to those selectable in the base game. It also contains eight new scenarios, some of which are set in concrete geographical areas. Though the player can select any aircraft for any scenario, some of the scenarios are specifically designed for a particular type of aircraft.

sample_screenshots.caption: New planes: MiG-25, Su-37, Shinden, F-86, MiG-15, Mirage III and Super Etendard

title: Air Combat II: Scenario Collection vol.2

description:
Jinpachi Tanaka is a paranormal investigator who possesses the powers of detecting and fighting demonic creatures. As these demons are usually female and pretty, they can easily pose as humans, and Jinpachi must use somewhat unorthodox (though physically pleasing) techniques to tell friend from foe. Jinpachi and his employees must cooperate with the police and avert grave dangers posed by an angry female demon who has sworn revenge against the hero.

Bacta is a Japanese-style adventure game. The player is presented with a text menu containing verbs, most of which lead to sub-menus with objects. Some of these commands are context-specific, while others ("Look", "Talk", "Move", etc.) are present in every situation. Sometimes events must be triggered by repeatedly selecting commands.

sample_screenshots.caption: Serves him right, btw this scene reminds me of similar one in Snatcher

title: Bacta

description:
The sequel to Bacta directly continues the story initiated in the first game. The paranormal investigator Jinpachi Tanaka was unable to defeat the female demon Dirsala, and she intends to resurrect the mysterious magical creation known as Bacta. In order to prevent that Jinpachi must work together with the local police and his faithful assistance, all the while continuing to save young women from demonic possession in his own unique ways.

Gameplay-wise, the sequel is identical to the predecessor. The Japanese-style adventure gameplay relies on selecting verb commands and combining them with objects in a text menu. It is impossible to get stuck or permanently die in the game, and many of the options, though not necessary to select for triggering the next event, are there for humorous reasons.
title: Bacta 2: The Resurrection of Bacta

alternate_titles.title: Hacchake Ayayo-san V: Pikapika no Shōwakusei

description: Ayayo's Dive Aflame is the fifth entry in the Hacchake Ayayo-san series. Ayayo, Tomoko, and two other female friends travel on a spaceship to another planet. However, they are abducted by an alien race ruled by a king with bizarre sexual preferences. The remainder of the plot is dedicated to exotic sexual scenes between the girls and the aliens. Like in its immediate predecessor, the gameplay is almost non-existent with just a couple of input instances that do not influence the course of the story.

sample_screenshots.caption: Afterwards it's all sex and mysticism
Bow to the king, human trash!

title: Ayayo's Dive Aflame

description: Goh is a turn-based military strategy game in which the player takes control of Japan during two decisive events of World War II: the attack on Pearl Harbor and the Battle of Midway. Any of these two scenarios can be selected from the main menu. The game focuses entirely on military tactics. Each turn consists of a preparatory and an active phase. During the first phase the player can opt to produce and assign aircraft to army units. The active phase involves tactically moving these units on a large-scale overhead world map, or choosing to attack any targets within the range of the planes.
title: Daitōa Mokushiroku: Goh

description: The sequel to Mahjong Houtei Raoyui has the same concept and gameplay as its predecessor. The player once again takes the role of a male high school student who must defeat female opponents in the game of strip mahjong. This time there are only five adversaries (as opposed to seven in the previous game), but they can be all tackled in any order. The mahjong game is always of the one-on-one variety. There are no selectable difficulty levels.
title: Hōtei Raoyui II

description: Like other installments in the series, Power Dolls 2 Dash is a mecha-themed turn-based tactical game. Visually and gameplay-wise it is nearly identical to Power Dolls 2. It introduces one new campaign which involves a series of infiltrations of important Earth-controlled strategic locations carried out by the Dolls unit of the Omni forces. The player can also choose to select any scenario from the seven available ones right from the beginning. Like other Power Dolls games, tactical planning and careful advancement take precedence over direct confrontation during the missions. Unlike previous games, there are two selectable difficulty levels, Normal and Easy.

sample_screenshots.caption: It all depends on you now, girl...
She can drive this intimidating vehicle!

title: Power Dolls 2 Dash

description: Advanced Power Dolls 2 is, like other installments in the series, a sci-fi mecha-themed turn-based tactical game. Visually and gameplay-wise it is nearly identical to Power Dolls 2 and Power Dolls 2 Dash, though without the selectable difficulty level of the latter. It introduces three new campaigns which depict a renewed struggle between the governments of Omni and Earth after an attempt at peaceful reconciliation by Omni was foiled. There is a greater number of selectable characters and specific vehicle requirements (types of planes, helicopters, etc.) for certain missions.

sample_screenshots.caption: This delivery plane is crucial for many missions
...as well as strange collages of the former...

title: Advanced Power Dolls 2

description:
The Queen of Duellist Gaiden is a follow-up to The Queen of Duellist. The game does not offer a new storyline in the introduction and instead simply allows players to control female fighters and compete in an enigmatic tournament. Unlike the first game, the player can select between five characters in the story mode, defeating the opponents one-by-one in a linear fashion and facing two non-controllable enemies in the end. All the five characters are new - none of the heroines of the previous game returns.

Compared to its predecessor, the game has a more elaborate control scheme, allowing executing of several unique moves and attacks per character by pressing down keys or combining them with directional arrows. These special moves include ranged fire and electricity attacks, complex jumps, grappling, etc. The difficulty level is noticeably higher as well. The player can select between three difficulty levels. Erotic pictures of the girls can be seen only if the game is completed on Normal or Hard (not Easy) difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: Apparently, Chizuru is a pianist. Hey, can you swing on "Mr. PC" or something?.. Put it in B flat minor :)
Err... are you sure you want to fight?..

title: The Queen of Duellist Gaiden

description: The follow-up to Fukujinzuke is a more elaborate supplement to Humming Bird's Record of Lodoss War computer RPG series and can be considered a mini-RPG. The game introduces six new pre-made characters in various races and classes. The player can choose to either export these characters to Record of Lodoss War II: Goshiki no Maryū, or import player-created characters from there. The player then builds a party out of any of these characters to go through either of the two modes: a series of battles in different locations and an exploration of a pseudo-3D third-person dungeon. The first mode allows shopping, resting, and healing in a generic town before engaging in combat; the second mode allows only a two-character party and awards items and equipment as rewards for guessing correctly what type of monsters ambushes the heroes in specific rooms.

sample_screenshots.caption: This dude explains the conditions to you
...and strike a comical pose at the second :)

title: Lodoss-Tō Senki: Fukujinzuke 2

description: The third Fukujinzuke installment returns to the mini-game format of the first, abandoning the more developed RPG-like scenarios of the second. The game features the same six characters as in the previous entry. Like before, these characters can be swapped with those of Record of Lodoss War II: Goshiki no Maryū; new to this installment is the possibility to import and export characters to Sword World PC. There are only two battle scenarios and no possibility to visit a town or acquire items. The dungeon exploration mode is gone as well and is replaced by a quiz mini-game in which the player takes control of Parn, one of the series' main protagonists, on a quest to defeat Emperor Beld. The player has to answer trivia questions within time limit and use abilities of Parn's companions to make this task easier.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is Emperor Beld - once a hero, now a bad guy
The quiz mode begins with Parn

title: Lodoss-Tō Senki: Fukujinzuke 3

description:
Regional Power III is a space strategy game. The player can either create an own scenario in a randomly generated map (setting the values for the number of planets and difficulty), or follow the campaign mode consisting of several scenarios, the first of which is set in the Tullaze star system and puts the player in control of the nascent Toran Federation. There is no option to select a scenario from the campaign directly from the main menu.

The game is very similar to its predecessor visually as well as gameplay-wise. The interface is nearly identical, though a few adjustments and refinements have been made: for example, planet surfaces are more detailed, and there are more precise options for colonization, construction, spaceship customization and research. The most noticeable choice is the addition of a new group in the command menu, which deals with interplanetary construction in player-controlled space, such as for example transportation routes between planets.

sample_screenshots.caption: The intro shows typical random assorted gauges and indicators...
That research has finally paid off

title: Regional Power III

description:
Sayaka Kimura is a twenty-six year old women married to an older man who has two teenage children, a boy and a girl. Controlling different members of this household, the player follows a plot that mostly consists of sexual encounters of various kinds.

Gibo: Sayaka plays mostly like a visual novel, with sparse movement and interaction, usually comprising context-specific action and dialogue choices. Most of the game is dedicated to sex scenes during which the player has to repeatedly go through the choices to trigger new ones and eventually conclude the scene.

sample_screenshots.caption: All the choices here are bad...

title: Gibo: Sayaka

description:
Oshioki Kirai! 2 is a humorous arcade-style action game. The player controls a permanently running character who must escape from a giant human attempting to kill him. The game is divided into stages taking place in the same area but featuring different opponents. Each opponent is presented as an animated digitized image of a gigantic person towering over the stage while the protagonist keeps running in a pseudo-3D motion away from the depth of the screen. The player must move the hero left and right in order to avoid attacks. If the player character is hit three times he dies and the game is over. Surviving for a certain while eventually leads to the opponent's demise and the end of the stage.

The opponents have comical appearance and try to kill the protagonist with various household items, mostly connected to food. For example, one of the foes attempts to pierce the hero with chopsticks, while another cleans his nose and throws gigantic dirty napkins on him. Digitized photos of various related scenes announce new rounds in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first opponent is kind of slow...
The napkin opponent can't handle his own filth any more :)

title: Oshioki Kirai! 2

description:
Panorama Club is a turn-based game with similarities to board games with adventure-like elements. There are four scenarios in the game, accessible directly from the main menu. The scenarios include a treasure hunt in a dungeon with traps, a polar rescue expedition, exploration of a modern apartment building, and saving various creatures in a fantasy environment.

Each scenario has its own goal. The player character (different in each scenario) and the AI-controlled opponent take turns in moving over a map divided into fields. The objective is to attain the goal of the scenario before the opponent. Each scenario, however, involves repeated visits to the same fields to trigger events and advance the story, giving the game a light adventure-like flavor.

Both the player character and the opponent have hit points, which can be reduced by stepping on fields with negative effects (such as hostile creatures, traps, etc.), but also replenished on other fields. Losing all hit points brings the character to square one. The game includes some scenes with explicit nudity.

sample_screenshots.caption: This has beneficial effect on you
Wait! Don't go into that cave!..

title: Panorama Club

description:
Celery is an arcade action game. In 1989 the inhabitants of the great underground city of Kanazawa had to defend themselves against an unusual peril: a tornado that took away the clothes of high school girls. The game consists of one-screen stages. The player controls a pad similar to those found in Pong games, moving it right and left (with limited up and down mobility) on the screen. Various objects keep falling down; some are beneficial (mushrooms enlarge the pad, coins increase score, clocks lengthen the time limit, etc.), while others (rocks, stop signs, etc.) are harmful, leading to a loss of a life and eventually to Game Over if the player-controlled pad touches them.

Other objects include speed-ups and exit signs, which automatically take the player to the next level. This, however, is hardly the goal, as the stages have to be completed the ordinary way, withstanding the onslaught of the objects for a sufficient amount of time. The bonus rewards are then calculated, and the player is shown a full-screen, full-color picture of the girl. Among the falling objects are also clothes items of the girl whose picture is shown in the background during gameplay; accumulating a sufficient amount of those leads to a nude picture of the girl.

sample_screenshots.caption: Get money; beware of those exit signs!
Not good - she is fully dressed :)

title: Celery

description: Venus is a fairly simple dating simulation game. The player controls a man named Saeki who gets acquainted with four young women, three Japanese and one Western. Each girl has her own preferences as well as parameters that describe her feelings towards the protagonist. The goal is to raise these parameters (and ultimately the girls' "love level") by repeatedly going on dates. From time to time the player is required to make choices that would influence subsequent dating. There is an internal clock that is advanced every time the player character goes on a date. Successful dating results in explicit erotic scenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: I hope she won't be using this...
Next, you meet another girl in the same place...

title: Venus

description:
In Paparazzo the player takes control of a young Japanese male journalist who works for an agency that primarily covers sports events. Dissatisfied with his position, the young man considers becoming a paparazzo, working on his own to get pictures of celebrities. From that point on the plot branches depending on the player's decisions, as the protagonist encounters various women and may pursue relationships with them.

Paparazzo is built like a visual novel. The scenes evolve automatically and the player's decisions are usually confined to choosing a location to visit. During the course of the game the protagonist may have relationship with many woman, including celebrities, colleagues, clients, a shop clerk, a high school student, etc. Ultimately it is the player's choice which woman the hero will stay with, leading to about ten independent endings.

sample_screenshots.caption: You meet a trio of pop singers...

title: Paparazzo

description:
Sword World PC is based on the Japanese table role-playing game Sword World, itself based on the Record of Lodoss Wars light novels which were initially created as role-playing "replays" of Dungeons & Dragons. It is set in the medieval world of Forcelia, which includes both the Lodoss island and the continent of Crystania from a series spin-off. The setting is similar to D&D games, having familiar medieval fantasy elements such as magic, races like elves and dwarves, etc.

Despite its Japanese origins and anime-style visuals, the game is closer to Western RPG format and attempts to recreate a table role-playing experience without focusing on character development or a linear plot. Though certain quests must be completed and events triggered in order to advance in the game, the player is for the most part free to venture to any city of the game world in any order. Navigation between the cities is menu-based, i.e. there is no wilderness exploration. Specific dungeons and other hostile areas can be accessed only by receiving respective missions. In such areas, as well as in locations within towns, player-controlled party can be physically navigated from an overhead perspective.

Character creation involves choosing a race (Human, Dwarf, Elf, two types of Half-Elves, or a halfling-like GrassRunner) and a class (Bard, Fighter, Priest, Ranger, Sage, Shaman, Sorcerer, or Thief). Character statistics and abilities are similar to those of D&D games. The player creates only one character, while the rest of the party consists of NPCs that can be convinced to join. Combat takes place in the same area as exploration and is of the tactical turn-based variety, allowing characters to move on the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: The party discovers a strange pedestal

title: Sword World PC

description:
A man named Shinichi encounters a mysterious young girl who tells him that she and her friends developed new technology that allows unprecedented immersion in virtual worlds. Shinichi is then chosen to be the test subject of the new virtual reality device, participating in adventures where his sexual powers are tested above all.

Paradise Arena consists of four independent "virtual reality" scenarios, each dedicated to a particular theme as the protagonists visits a harem, enters an agency that promotes pop singers, is hired as a tutor, and travels to an airport. Each scenario consists almost entirely of seduction scenes that eventually lead to explicit sex scenes. The game plays similarly to visual novels, albeit with several choices during every scene. Rather than making one decision, the player has to repeatedly select options and check how they influence a counter that reports the woman's mood. When this counter reaches zero the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: You'll need to have sex with a sleeping girl. That's really highly moral... compared to the usual rape in Japanese games
...and this... errrr... theme is rather... err... convincing

title: Paradise Arena

description:
Patlabor: Operation Tokyo Bay is a real-time city-building simulation somewhat similar to SimCity series. The setting is taken from the Patlabor anime series, more specifically Patlabor: The Movie (1989). The story begins in 1998, when Tokyo Bay undergoes a drastic re-development, which includes the construction of artificial islands under the codename "Babylon Project". The player is entrusted with the task of designing the infrastructure of the city. Four types of pre-made transportation networks can be selected before the actual construction begins. The player is also prompted to position electricity, water, and other resources on the map before getting started.

The game then proceeds in real time, with natural disasters such as earthquakes, typhoons, etc. frequently disrupting the player's progress. The player assigns team to work on construction projects and also invests money in the development. It is possible to build hotels, schools, parks, factories, and other types of urban scenery.

The key plot element of the movie - the series' trademark giant mechas known as Labors mysteriously going rogue - is also used for gameplay purposes. Hostile Labors would randomly assault the team, and the player has to decide whether to attack or negotiate with them. Defeated or otherwise convinced Labors then join the team and affect the city's future development.

sample_screenshots.caption: Now a typhoon is coming... come on!..

title: Patlabor: Operation Tokyo Bay

description:
The year is 2035. A series of mysterious incidents began to occur in Tokyo. Young women disappeared under strange circumstances, and returned brainwashed, commanding armies of bionic monsters and assaulting human settlements. Such women were called "Possessioners". A special all-female squad was formed to face them in combat and bring them back to humanity.

Possessioner is primarily a Japanese-style adventure game. The player selects verb commands from a menu and combines them with objects appearing afterwards to interact with the environment and trigger events. Navigation is menu-based as well. The game also contains sporadic turn-based battles against the Possessioners and their minions. Four female combatants have a variety of attacks at their disposal, but the battles are fairly simple and there is no role-playing system. The game contains scenes with nudity and explicit, exclusively lesbian sex scenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Talking to a team member / best friend / occasional lesbian lover

title: Possessioner

description:
Yūichi Sayama is a first-year college student. Ever since his parents died in an accident he has been unable to remember anything that happened before he was eight years old. One day, a mysterious girl named Mizuki suddenly appears in front of him. She tells him that she is a succubus and that he had made a promise to her ten years ago and now owes all his attention to her. Unable to recall that promise, Yūichi tries to recollect the events of the past, all the while becoming involved in relationships with the women surrounding him.

Promise is a visual novel. Most scenes offer only one course of action for the player, advancing by themselves with minimum input. However, the player is often free to choose which location to go to first. These and a few other choices may influence subsequent scenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: You'll have to buy clothes for Mizuki...
Not all characters are pretty girls

title: Yakusoku - Promise

description:
News Chrome is a young FBI agent who was pursuing an evasive target on a mission. Suddenly, the suspect disappeared into a portal. Following him, News found himself in a desert. Before long he meets a princess named Sarah who asks him to aid the inhabitants of the magical world Quintia against a mysterious sorcerer.

The sequel to Quintia Road has a similar Japanese-style menu-based verb interface, this time also allowing some basic combinations with objects from a list. Game progression is for the most part strictly linear, with only a few instances allowing the player to choose the next destination.

Like in the previous game, there are sporadic scripted turn-based battles. The sequel features a more developed RPG-like system that allows the player to distribute experience points gained after battle to raise the combatants' attributes. However, as there is no possibility to freely engage in combat, this feature has little impact on the advancement of the game. Like the predecessor, the game contains scenes with nudity and explicit sexual situations.

sample_screenshots.caption: Talking to Sarah in a quiet inn

title: Quintia Road II

description:
Reiji Imari is an ordinary teenager who doesn't get much attention from his female schoolmates. He has a tendency to voyeurism and likes spying on girls and taking their photos. One day his young and attractive teacher catches him during such an escapade, and as a result he is obliged to follow her orders, which may also include sexual services.

Rabyni (A Russian word meaning "female slaves") plays like a Japanese-style adventure, albeit without regular verb commands and no possibility to interact with the environment by selecting objects from a menu. Most of the gameplay involves repeatedly visiting different locations and triggering events. There are no branches in the storyline. Explicit sexual cutscenes are animated.
title: Rabyni

description:
Keisuke Murakawa is a teenager who used to have tender feelings towards his childhood friend Makoto Aizawa. However, they grew apart as each was busy with their own school life. Now, when both begin to attend the same high school, Keisuke is unsure whether she or any of the older attractive schoolmates is the love of his life.

Ribbon is a visual novel. The game requires the player to choose between two or more possible responses or actions during almost every scene, often multiple times. Going to certain locations or making different choices will branch the story. It is necessary to complete the initial scenario without getting a bad ending in order to proceed to the next chapter. The game focuses on dating and each branch of the story is dedicated to a particular female character. The game contains scenes with explicit sexual content.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...before you can touch her in such a way...
You can always just read porn manga...

title: Ribbon

description:
The young private investigator Hiroshi Musō has a troubled past involving amnesia and the death of the man he considered his father. He opened his office to pursue crime, aided by his lovely servant Medi. One day, a school girl calls Musō and tells him her father has disappeared. The detective agrees to take the case and soon discovers a net of crime and corruption in the city.

Rose is a Japanese-style detective adventure. Most screens offer the player a menu with a selection of verbs, mostly including looking, talking, sometimes asking or taking, and a special command referring to a sexual act. Navigation is done by selecting locations from a menu as well. It is usually necessary to question every person about every topic, and visit locations multiple times to advance the story. The game has explicit sex scenes, some of which are animated.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the office, talking to the seductively dressed Medi

title: Rose

description:
The follow-up to Zavas is, like its predecessor, a fantasy role-playing game with Japanese anime-like aesthetics, but more Western-oriented free-form gameplay with more emphasis on character development than on a character-driven plot. Through a series of choices the player make the protagonist (always named Majon, but with different family names) to be a prince, the son of a merchant, or the son of a fisherman. In the beginning the player character undergoes a series of trials (which may include arcade-style mini-games, mathematical tasks, etc.) which determine his eventual attributes and also follow his growth until he turns sixteen and embarks on a quest to find companions and defeat an evil sorcerer in accordance with an ancient prophecy.

Though the game has a traditional overworld with towns, hostile areas, and fairly simple turn-based battles, many of its gameplay features deviate from the standard Japanese template. Every NPC can be approached with different attitudes (including bribe and usage of items), and often a specific attitude is needed to further the hero's goals. Money can be earned and managed through various activities. Experience points are awarded for conversations and other actions besides combat. An important factor is the party's stamina: a certain amount of it must be reached in order to access key plot-advancing locations, and building up stamina through side quests and other actions occupies a considerable portion of the gameplay. The protagonist has a ship at his disposal from the beginning of the game, and it is possible to physically sail across the sea and access any location, provided the stamina level is high enough.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the early attribute-building mini-games is swimming against currents, trying to increase your future HP

title: Zavas II: The Prophecy of Mehitae

description: Russian Mahjong Harashō! is a one-on-one mahjong game. The protagonist is a young man who loses to a mysterious old witch in a mahjong match and as a result is turned into a woman and sent into a strange castle. In order to regain his former self he has to defeat young female opponents in mahjong. The order of these opponents is dictated by the plot; there is no option to play against them separately. After certain winning conditions are met (usually after the girl loses a fixed amount of money) the opponent removes an article of her clothing, eventually resulting in naked erotic images and transition to the next opponent.

sample_screenshots.caption: Advanced stage - I have amassed some combos
I've made too many combos. I have only two tiles left and it looks like nothing good can come any more

title: Russian Mahjong Harashō!

description:
Saint Diary is a visual novel focusing on the romantic life of a high school student named Kiyoka (the Chinese character used to spell here name means "saint"), who works as a waitress at the local cafe during a vacation. The protagonist of the game is a male college student who frequents the cafe and gradually develops a relationship with Kiyoka. Though there are two other female characters in the game, the dating aspect focuses exclusively on Kiyoka.

Like in most visual novels, interaction is sporadic and limited; as opposed to most representatives of the genre, instead of making a choice between two or more context-specific actions the player is prompted to select a command ("Look", "Talk", or "Action") within a time limit. Failure to make a choice, however, does not incur any penalty besides slightly influencing subsequent events. When dating Kiyoka the player is able to choose a location for the date, which also affects the following scenes. Eventually the couple engages in sexual intercourse, which is displayed explicitly.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choices in front of a door
...and by "advances", I mean really, REALLY advances

title: Saint Diary: Kiyoka-chan no Nikki

description:
Long time ago, human passions caused the appearance of a monster tribe that has since become unwelcome in the human society. Years of bitter antagonism and violence followed as humans settled in the land of Galesnia. A thousand years later, a simple warrior named Grog enters a forest inhabited by monsters, and becomes gradually involved in a struggle that puts him in the forefront of the defense of Galesnia.

Guernica is a Japanese-style role-playing game with radically simplified gameplay mechanics. There is no party, no monetary system, and no equipment of any kind. Only bars and inns can be accessed in towns. The world map is completely linear, as the protagonist is only able to move on the roads and locations appear on it only when triggered by the plot. Much of the game consists of exploring hostile locations, fighting randomly appearing enemies in turn-based combat that allows only physical attacks and usage of healing items that are randomly dropped by the foes. The game's cutscenes mostly depict explicit sexual encounters.

sample_screenshots.caption: A few scenes show the protagonist himself
...let me show just how exactly thankful I am

title: Guernica

description: School Girls tells the story of Shinsuke, a young man looking for a teaching job. His uncle is the principal of a prestigious girls' high school, and he assigns to his nephew the job of a substitute art teacher. The rest of the plot is mostly dedicated to Shinsuke's relationships (sexual and otherwise) with the various female students and co-workers. The game allows no interaction besides choosing a location in the school to visit (office, gym, main gate, etc.). Going to specific locations triggers scenes that eventually advance the story. At certain points the player will also be prompted to make a choice regarding a context-specific action. Many of these choices, however, are purely cosmetic and do not affect the plot.
title: School Girls

description: Momoko-chan for Me: Minarai Kangofu-hen is a visual novel focusing on a young male aspiring physician, the son of a famous doctor who has left on a vacation and entrusted the son with the management of certain hospital-related affairs. The game focuses exclusively on the relationship between the protagonist and a nurse-in-training named Momoko. The visual novel-like structure allows only limited interaction, which is mostly confined to making a choice that would affect subsequent scenes. Almost the entire game consists of various sex scenes with Momoko, with only a few images dedicated to other women.

sample_screenshots.caption: The actual gameplay portions are nearly non-existent and take place in an ungly small window

title: Momoko-chan for Me: Minarai Kangofu-hen

description:
The protagonist of the game is a young Japanese man who is lucky enough to win a ride on the S-Express, a miraculous train connecting Australia with Canada and going through almost the entire world with stops in Singapore, Japan, China, India, Israel, Russia, France, Ivory Coast, Brazil, Panama, and USA. Nearly the whole game is set on the train itself, with only a few locations accessible within.

Sexpress is built like a visual novel, with the player's input entirely confined to selecting locations on the train, triggering scenes. Each such scene advances the time needed for the train to reach the next stop. The goal is to develop relationships with the several female characters onboard the train, and unlock as many sex scenes as possible with them. New girls board the train continuously as the journey advances. Failure to trigger a sufficient amount of scenes will end the trip (and the journey) prematurely before the final destination (Quebec) is reached.

sample_screenshots.caption: The map of the journey and current location
Look down before it's too late

title: Sexpress

description:
Dungeon Harlem is a first-person dungeon crawler. The player controls a naked female warrior named Esbe, who is contacted by the Goddess of Peace with the request to exterminate monsters inhabiting underground labyrinths and rescue young women abducted by them. The game is set in a pseudo-3D maze-like environment. Enemies appear randomly and Esbe fights them solo in turn-based fashion, using a physical attack or a magic spell, which requires magic points.

Finding and rescuing the woman trapped in the dungeon may award Esbe with useful items (such as a light device that improves visibility during exploration) or better weapons. Enemies may be more or less susceptible to physical or magical attacks. There is no possibility to use items in combat or generally use any healing items. Special water springs found in different corners of the maze restore either hit points or magic points to the full. The game contains scenes with explicit nudity.

sample_screenshots.caption: This girl gives you a monster compendium
Hey there. Nice to meet you!
These guys restore either your health or magic

title: Dungeon Harlem

description:
Tir-nan-óg: Descendants of Danaan is a role-playing game based on Irish mythology, more specifically the story of Tír na nÓg (the land of eternal youth) and the Tuatha Dé Danann (people of the goddess Dana). The main plot of the game is only loosely based on actual Irish myths and involves the fictional kingdom of Annafofo, the assault of demons, the abduction of the princess, and a legendary hero who must rectify all that and restore peace in the land.

Despite its Japanese origins, the game follows a Western template, focusing on non-linear exploration rather than a character-driven plot. The game begins with the player controlling a single pre-defined character, though some NPCs will be able to join the party. All navigation in the game is done by moving an arrow representing the party on the world map or through the dungeons, which are viewed from a top-down perspective as well. Towns have no graphics at all and all interaction there is menu-based. Turn-based combat takes place on separate overhead screens and resembles that of Ultima games, allowing free movement on the battle field.

sample_screenshots.caption: Stuck between two enemies, on the verge of death...

title: Tir-nan-óg: Descendants of Danaan

description:
The Sign of Chaos is a sequel to Descendants of Danaan, set in the same fantasy world based on Irish mythology. The legendary hero has accomplished his mission, but the forces of darkness were too strong, and as a result four kingdoms were engulfed in chaos, overrun by monstrous creatures. The hero travels to the land of Fianapia and teams up with the local princess to cleanse the country of evil.

The basic gameplay system is similar to that of the predecessor, relying on Ultima-like role-playing template with free-form exploration of a vast overhead map. Dungeons are viewed from a top-down perspective as well. Turn-based combat takes place against randomly appearing enemies on separate battle screens where tactical navigation is possible. Changes include graphical towns, character icons displayed during navigation, and the possibility to converse with or even recruit certain type of potentially hostile creatures encountered in the wilderness.
title: Tir-nan-óg II: The Sign of Chaos

description:
The heroine Caron, a descendant of a legendary swordsman, must defeat the cruel monster Gebalzo, the leader of the Shadow Empire, in order to save Rubyna, the the princess of Rall he abducted.

Rall III: Kakusei-hen is based on the adult anime Superdimension SF Legend Rall (1984), serving as its third episode as well as a re-imagining of the first one. The game is an adult visual novel. The gameplay consists entirely of making choices. The player chooses destinations (a village, a castle, a cave, etc.) from a map screen, moving the heroine ahead and advancing the story. In some key points during the plot, the heroine may encounter an enemy. The player fights the enemy making full use of decided choices, such as attack, defense, etc. However, the heroine always wins irrespective of the player's decisions.

sample_screenshots.caption: Princess Rubyna has been captured and, of course, the bad guys go full sexual assault on her

title: Rall III: Kakusei-hen

description: Wrestle Angels V2 is the sixth title in the long-running Wrestle Angels wrestling management sim franchise. It is a remake of Wrestle Angels 2, following the same general story, but featuring the in-depth management system and many of the new characters introduced in the previous title. The interface has been streamlined since the previous title, and several new options and rule changes have been introduced, but the gameplay is generally the same as before.

sample_screenshots.caption: Here you have a choice of how to break this grip

title: Wrestle Angels V2

description: Brocken is a basic dungeon RPG. A hero and his female companion travel through dungeons and fight various mythological creatures in order to get treasure. Like most eroge of this kind, some of these enemies are pretty girls. After defeating bosses, adult scenes play out. There isn't any leveling up or tactics, but the player can upgrade and buy new equipment.

sample_screenshots.caption: Battle with a cute girl opponent.

title: Brocken

description: In this sequel, the player, who is now in a steady romantic relationship with love interest Arisa, finds himself falling for another girl named Yui. Naturally, Arisa is unhappy about this. You must help the protagonist make the right decisions, or he'll have nobody at all.
title: Vision 2

description: Lemon Angel: Sakurai Tomo no Speed Game is a simple card game based on the Lemon Angel animated series, although whether it is licensed or not is unclear. The goal is to discard all your cards before Tomo discards all of her cards. After you win a round, she starts taking her clothes off.

sample_screenshots.caption: If you lose, you're greeted with this image before the game restarts.

title: Lemon Angel: Sakurai Tomo no Speed Game

description: Gal Pani is a personal computer spinoff of the Gals Panic series. Like the rest of the series, the goal is to uncover the silhouette of a female model. This is done through Qix-like gameplay. All models in this game are photographic, and there is nudity.
title: Gal Pani

description:
You start the game as a member of a mercenary squad piloting Motor Shells, infantry mechs deployed from space. The squad is under contract by the government and stationed onboard the battleship Dragonet, tasked with various dirty jobs like subduing colonial uprisings and cleaning up orbital bio factories that have gone out of control. Inevitably events unfold that leave you as the only one who can prevent a mysterious invader from taking control of the galaxy.

Starcraft Inc. is mainly known for porting numerous popular western games from DOS to Japanese home computer systems like PC-98 and FM Towns. Starfire is one of their few original games, but uses an engine taken from the Might & Magic series of games they translated and ported to PC-98 in the early 90's. It retains the 3D first person dungeon crawler navigation and sprite based graphics, but the classic RPG encounters are replaced with a simple real time action-based combat where you shoot the enemies as they appear on screen. Instead of levels and experience points you increase your combat stats through upgrades from engineers and doctors. Killing enemies provide you with credits to spend at item shops and arms dealers.

Eventually you gain access to a space ship, which enables you to travel the galaxy. That also means running into hostile space ships that you will have to fend off in simple space battles. To unravel the plot you have to visit the various systems and their space stations and talk with the characters that live on them, eliminating space pirates and alien forces along the way.

sample_screenshots.caption: The bridge of your own, little ship, the Blue Streak
Star systems can have multiple planets

title: Starfire

description: Hercequary is a eroge 2D fighting game featuring eight female warriors. It is possible to play against the computer or against another player. After each battle the defeated opponents will appear in sexually explicit cutscenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Player select. I pick the knight Rosa.

title: Hercequary

description: Animahjong X Perfect is an add-on for Animahjong X. It adds a four-player multiplayer mode as well as replay and music room options.
title: Animahjong X Perfect

description: T&E Selection is the second golf course add-on for Harukanaru Augusta.

sample_screenshots.caption: Caddie gives advice on how to make this birdie

title: New 3D Golf Simulation: T&E Selection

description:
Farland Story: Juuou no Akashi is the seventh entry in the Farland Story series, and the final installment for the PC-98. Like its predecessor, Juuou no Akashi brings the familiar, light tactics gameplay of the rest of the series to a brand-new setting. This world is filled with the descendants of beast-gods, who can transform into the animal of their tribe. You play as Van, the son of the chief of the Lion Tribe, who meets a human princess trying to lift the curse a beastman placed on her father. Van recruits a colorful cast of characters from the various beast tribes, as well as humans, fairies, elves, and vampires.

As in the rest of the series, the game is split between lengthy dialogue scenes and top-down turn-based tactical battles. In battle, you issue commands to each of your units to move, attack, and cast spells, and the enemies do the same on their turn. Each character earns experience immediately after attacking or counter-attacking, and can pick up weapons from the defeated enemies.

Like in the previous installment, each character has a unique ability, like a stealth mode, or diving to move quickly in water, or causing an earthquake. In addition, beast characters can transform in and out of their animal form to alter their statistics and abilities.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main character's father, the Lion King

title: Farland Story: Juuou no Akashi

description:
CrEastar is an RPG game set on another planet. Players take the role of Alex, a warrior in a mecha suit who witnesses the destruction of his hometown by invaders from space.

The game plays out like a typical turn-based RPG with some exceptions such as the ability to target multiple enemies in one attack and healing by taking steps. Alex also gains back some HP after each battle. Alex can increase his max HP by either leveling up after gathering enough experience or finding power-ups hidden in various areas and can jump to get over gaps in caves. The enemies are not visible on the map and the random encounter rate is set quite high. Battles are shown in an over-the-shoulder perspective similar to Phantasy Star II. Enemies can be at different distances to the protagonist, the further they are away from him, the more likely the player is to escape from a battle or attack first.

sample_screenshots.caption: We start the game next to our hometown shortly before the crash.
I'm so glad I wasn't in there when this happened.

title: CrEastar: Planets in Legend

description:
This compilation contains 3 add-on scenarios for Harpoon:

  • North Atlantic Convoys (NACV)
  • The Mediterranean Conflict (MEDC)
  • Indian Ocean / Persian Gulf (IOPG)

Harpoon: The Next Mission is a standalone release and doesn't require the original game to play.
title: Harpoon: The Next Mission

description:
Soko-ban Select 30 is a top-down puzzle game with 30 stages. Like the other Sōkoban games, the objective is to push all crates onto designated spots. One visual difference from the other titles is that in this game the crates have real life brands on them.

The game was included on extra disk with purchase of KAO blank floppy disk pack.
title: Soko-ban Select 30

description:
The Story of King Aress is a turn-based strategy game taking place in the world of Elenes. Players take control of Aress, who, on his 16th birthday, wakes up in hopes of getting a surprise from his father Rudolph Adfral, but finds only a letter informing him that he is actually the son of a king and was taken into custody in order to protect him from harm. Having brought up and taught Aress for 16 years, his adoptive father ends the letter by telling Aress that he's free to choose his fate when he becomes the king. Aress goes out on an adventure with his two friends to claim the throne and restore his home country.

The game takes place in a world map where players choose where they want to go. After making a choice, players will encounter dialogues or cutscenes which will be accompanied with a battle. Combat is turn-based with the players clicking on the characters they wish to control and moving them to an available area. When players attack the enemy or vice versa, the attacks will be shown in a different perspective. Combat is quite slow paced as both characters take turns to approach each other and land a hit with each character attacking multiple times in one turn. Characters on the battlefield may attack with different weapons, such as bows and arrows, swords, spears, clubs and other blunt weapons.

sample_screenshots.caption: A few images with a backstory.
The archer is lucky. The enemy is too far from him.
You can see the stats of the character you're attacking before you confirm your choice.

title: The Story of King Aress

description: Slip Stream '93 Rev-LIMIT is an enhanced version of Slip Stream '93. It is a flat-shaded 3D racing game played from a first-person, behind view, or top-down perspective. There are fifteen different tracks and eight types of cars to choose from. You can choose to play either a Championship Race, Single Race, or VS. Battle (direct serial/null modem or telephone modem connection required). For controlling the game, a keyboard, digital/analog joystick, mouse, or Radicon Propo are supported.
title: Slip Stream '93 Rev-LIMIT

description:
Carmen Sandiego is a master thief who leads the criminal organization V.I.L.E. This organization specializes in stealing Japan's treasures without a trace. Alarmed by this, the player has been tasked with hunting down V.I.L.E.'s henchmen and eventually Carmen Sandiego herself.

Carmen Sandiego in Japan is a game that tests the player's knowledge about Japanese geography. Missions begin with a treasure being stolen and the player arriving at that location. A time limit counts down while they search the area and interview witnesses to find which prefecture the thief flew to next. The player always has a limited selection of places to visit. This process is repeated until either the villain is found or time expires and they are able to get away.

Along with finding out where the thief has headed, the player must discover who the thief is, by best matching personal characteristics (gender, hair color, eye color, hobbies, notable features) to dossiers on Carmen's gang. There must be enough characteristics matched in order to obtain a warrant, which is essential to legally arrest the suspect once they have been found. Progress in arresting VILE members will expose other members, eventually leading up to Carmen Sandiego herself.
title: Carmen Sandiego in Japan

description: Gage is a roguelike where you ascend the tower of Gage. Your goal is to fight through monsters to the get to top of the tower, where you must confront the Dark Lord Mick Albert. Along your way you can recruit allied to help you in your journey and grab whatever items you find to help you.

sample_screenshots.caption: Found a key while 2 jelly monsters close in

title: Gage

description:
Mujintō Monogatari Memorial Version is a compilation containing the first 3 games in the series:

  • Mujintō Monogatari
  • Mujintō Monogatari 2
  • Mujintō Monogatari 3: A.D.1999 Tokyo
title: Mujintō Monogatari: Memorial Version

description: This Power Up Kit updates Daisenryaku III: Great Commander to Daisenryaku III '90.
title: Daisenryaku III Power Up Kit

description:
This compilation contains CD-ROM versions of:

  • Brandish
  • Brandish 2: The Planet Buster
  • Brandish 3: Spirit of Balcan
  • Brandish VT

Also included is Brandish MIDI Collection on a hybrid CD-ROM for Windows 95, Windows 3.1 and Macintosh.
title: Brandish Special Box '97

description: Rittai-ban: Yūgeki-ō is a 3D flight and air combat simulation seen from a first-person cockpit perspective. The player can choose between a color 3D mode and stereo Red-Blue 3D mode. Red-Blue 3D glasses are included. The player can choose between mission and flight modes. Mission mode involves travelling to specific destinations and fulfilling particular objectives (such as eliminating a number of enemy aircraft). Flight mode allows the player to choose a real-world location from cities such as Tokyo, Egypt, London and others. In Combat mode the enemy is an invading fighter like Dassault Mirage III. The scenario is based on Chohei Kambayashi's Yukikaze.
title: Rittai-ban: Yūgeki-ō

description: Daisenryaku: Power Up Set is a follow-up to the original Gendai Daisenryaku, with new AI and maps, weapons. This package contained 30 new maps and three new weapons.
title: Daisenryaku: Power Up Set

description: Hozonban Lode Runner is a variant of the original Lode Runner game, but with new music and colorful graphics. This package includes 150 legacy levels, Championship Lode Runner's 50 levels and 100 new original levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Start of the first level (from Lode Runner)
There's two ways to cycle through the levels: either with the arrow keys

title: Hozonban Lode Runner

description: Air Combat III is a first-person flight and air combat simulation. The player belong is a MACH (Mercenary of Air force Control Headhunter) and fights to stop conflicts in different parts of the world. The missions have abstract names and are associated with particular geographical locations. Available aircraft are F-14A, F-15, F-16, F/A-18A, F-22, F-117, F-4, F-5E, A-10, Su-24, Su-27, Mig-21, Mig-29, Mig-31, Rafale, AV-8B, Panavia Tornado and GRIPEN. Each of these can be outfitted with different weapons.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choose an aircraft for your wingman

title: Air Combat III

description: Azusa 999 is an RPG Maker game centered around a train. It depicts an emotional tale about suicide, hopelessness, and life. In the game, you play as "Hope". As you work your way through the train, the story slowly unveils revealing the truth about the train and its passengers.
title: Azusa 999

description: Dark Wraith is a first-person grid-based dungeon crawler game, similar to Wizardry or The Bard's Tale. The main character is Zion, a magic user that finds out that a friendly town-person's daughter has been kidnapped by the Dark Wraith as part of a periodic ritual sacrifice. Up to four other characters can accompany Zion as he searches various dungeons in search of the Dark Wraith. As with many Japanese dungeon crawlers, characters are not created by the player. Rather, they are met throughout the story. However, upon leveling up, the player gets to assign points to various skills and attributes. The game features turn-based combat with enemies appearing within the dungeon, similar to Might and Magic games.

sample_screenshots.caption: Dungeon, here you can also use the on-screen arrows to navigate
Town at night; most establishments are closed but...

title: Dark Wraith

description:
Shūjin e no Pert-em-Hru is a freeware horror adventure game created for the PC-98 using RPG Maker Dante 98 II.

The game takes place in Egypt, where Professor Tsuchida, a leading expert on archaeology, goes on an expedition into the lower levels of the Great Pyramid of Giza with his assistant, Dr. Kōji Kuroe. After an excavator they've hired is killed by a trap in the pyramid, Professor Tsuchida decides to make use of the Japanese tourists he had seen when entering the pyramid as cannon fodder.

Players take control of Ayuto Asaki, an 18 year old high school graduate who was chosen by the Professor to lead the group and they will need to go deeper into the pyramid to find the secrets of the pyramid. While going through the game, players will need to do certain actions if they wish to avoid the deaths of the 11 people that ventured into the pyramid. These actions are pushing or pulling objects, crawling through small openings, looking up, taking certain items. Some of these actions may also be used in the turn-based battles that the game offers. These battles are triggered by the events of the plot or by random encounters.

sample_screenshots.caption: And now we must fight her to save the photographer.
Well, what do you know? There really is a woman in the ruins!
We somehow made it to the other side, but the ship is no longer to be found.

title: Shūjin e no Pert-em-Hru

description: Chitty Chitty Train is a puzzle game about coordinating trains. Guide your train to pick up all passengers and reach the exit without colliding with other trains or obstacles. The game also contains a level editor to modify levels.
title: Chitty Chitty Train

description: Zeta is an adventure game with light dungeon crawling elements. The star ship Pilgrims is sent to investigate an accident on the planet Z (or Zeta-3) in the Zeta star system, and find out what happened to the first investigation team sent earlier, and to search for the lost transport ship Sanctuary. A development base on Z was destroyed under mysterious circumstances 100 years ago, which is suspected to be related to the more recent disappearances. Players take control of crew member Kou Asamiya aboard the Pilgrims, as it encounters an emergency in an asteroid belt, and some crew members appear to suffer from memory loss.
title: Zeta

description:
Nirvana is a Japanese sci-fi adventure game with occasional turn-based combat. It is the sequel to the PC-98 game Zeta.

100 years after the events of Zeta, planet Earth is in decline and most humans desperately want to emigrate to the space colony El Divide which is seen as a utopia. Players follow the character Lex, who is part of a group of criminals who manufacture and sell counterfeit travel passes to El Divide.

sample_screenshots.caption: Talking to people in the street

title: Nirvana

description:
Michihiko Kusakabe is a private detective. On his 30th birthday, he gets a request to investigate a drug distribution case happening in an all-girls high school. He then goes to the school to investigate.

Rookies is an adult-themed visual novel. The gameplay is limited to occasional choices, which might trigger different scenes.

sample_screenshots.caption: The graphics in this game are very impressive even for primitive system like the PC-98

title: Rookies

description:
This compilation contains Mark Flint's first five games:

  • Brown's Run
  • Highway Star
  • Moon Ball
  • Valiant
  • Zone
title: All About Mark-Flint

description: It is October 1989. The Japanese cult Aum Shinrikyō is establishing a foothold in Tokyo. This strategy game has the player make use of resources and manpower to build up the cult group, while evading police and miltant forces. The cult must ultimately conquer the city ending with a sarin gas attack, otherwise the whole world is doomed to end. The game contains satirical imagery and audio of the gang as well as Japanese porn, featured during the gameplay.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game uses real-life footage of the Aum Shinrikyo cult
Main map; Asahara's portrait in the upper right corner, below it are the player's stats

title: Kamikuishiki-mura Monogatari

description:
Sangokushi IV: Power Up Kit is an expansion pack for Romance of the Three Kingdoms IV: Wall of Fire. It adds following features to the base game:

  • In-game editor
  • Single combat mode
  • 3 new fictional scenarios
  • New historical events
  • Profiles of all officers
  • AI improvement
title: Sangokushi IV: Power Up Kit

description:
The expansion pack for Nobunaga no Yabō: Haōden adds following features to the base game:* Officer editor

  • 2 new scenarios along with 180 new officers
  • Officer profiles
  • Enhanced AI based on artificial neural networks
  • New events
  • Every scenario now has an graphical opening which introduces the historical background and the relationship among the lords
title: Nobunaga no Yabō: Haōden - Power Up Kit

description:
The expansion pack for Nobunaga no Yabō: Tenshōki adds following features to the base game:* 3 new scenarios along with 300 new officers

  • In-game editor
  • New events
  • Profiles of in-game castles and items
  • AI improvements
title: Nobunaga no Yabō: Tenshōki - Power Up Kit

description:
This compilation contains:

  • Red Storm Rising
  • M1 Tank Platoon
title: Weapons of War

description: Kaze e Tsubasa yo, Ai aru tokoro e is a simulation game in which you raise and race pigeons.
title: Kaze e Tsubasa yo, Ai aru tokoro e

description: The second installment of the horror RPG series written by Hitoshi Yasuda of Group SNE. Six years after the incident at Weathertop Mansion depicted in Laplace no Ma, the explorers who survived the tragedy encounter a new incident set in Europe, which is suffering from the Great Depression.
title: Paracelsus no Maken

description: An updated version of Hiroku Kubikiri Yakata, but containing more explicit and adult-related content not found in the original releases.
title: Chikudenya Tōbee: Hiroku Chigyaku no Yakata

description:
It is the year 2086. Earth has finally joined the Galactic Union; people, knowledge, and technology can now freely travel to and from Earth. New technology is solving many of humanity's problems, such as disease and food shortage, and galactic tourism is quickly becoming a boon for Earth's economy. However, not all changes are positive: with its borders open, Earth is no longer considered a protected location by the Galactic Union, and not everyone who might come to the planet is there just to see the sights. The Galaxy Police are dedicated to fighting interplanetary crime, and while they may provide the tools, Earth itself must provide the talent, and those recruits are going to need some training to keep the peace.

MeltyLancer is a life simulation game similar to -- and by the same designers as -- Graduation, in which the player is tasked with training a squad of six young Tokyo Eastern Metro Police recruits, called Lancers. The main core of the game is determining each Lancer's weekly schedule: which days are they on patrol, which days on standby, and which days do they have off? After the general schedule is determined, the player meets with each Lancer to speak with them directly, determining specific actions they'll take that week; whether they spend a day training, exercising, or getting some much-needed rest will affect their stats and ability to complete missions. While on patrol or on special missions, battles may occur, which can be partially controlled with a handful of commands but mostly play out automatically. Each of the six Lancers has their own abilities, personalities, and specialties.

A mini-CD containing the game's theme song is also included in the package.

sample_screenshots.caption: Some stats go up, some go down

title: The Melting Pot Police: MeltyLancer

description: Progenitor is a space adventure/strategy game. You play as Kenny, a space pirate searching for his long-lost father. There are over a dozen explorable planets where you can buy and sell goods and perform tasks. Demand for goods (and their prices) change based on the characteristics of the planet you're on.

sample_screenshots.caption: Galaxy map. All named planets are explorable!

title: Progenitor

description: Primal Space is a universe simulation game, starting all the way from the beginning at the Big Bang.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is the initial setup screen after starting a new game, there are some presets to pick from.
Chapter 1 begins, there are some pop-up information windows you can enable.

title: Primal Space

description:
Teitoku no Ketsudan III: Power Up Kit is an expansion pack for Teitoku no Ketsudan III which adds numerous features and new content to the base game:

  • Seven additional campaign scenarios depicting fictional what-if situations.
  • Seven additional short scenarios based on specific WW2 battles.
  • Removed restrictions on upgrading unit performance.
  • New weapon types added.
  • Various game system adjustments and improvements.
title: Teitoku no Ketsudan III: Power Up Kit

description:
Reines Du Sabbat is a Japanese Role-Playing Game.

The game takes place in the country of Serfina. In a small hut there lived a girl called Puff, together with her older brother, Lux. Since they've lost their parents at an early age, the older brother had to take the parent role and take care of his little sister. However, one day, Lux suddenly fell ill with a fever of an unknown origin, with no doctor able to help and him gradually losing his strength. Puff heard about a medicinal herb called the Snow Herb that can quickly bring down any kind of fever and went to the forest of Pia to find it. In the forest, being absorbed in the beautiful flowers blooming there Puff lost her uncle.

This is where the game begins and Puff's journey will lead her to witness the cruelty of human beings...

sample_screenshots.caption: The big rat Rai lets us through.
Only to attack us from behind.
Roux finds Puff sleeping in this bed.

title: Reines Du Sabbat

description: Ōedo Renaissance is an economic simulation game set in 18th-century Edo, Japan, based on the life of infamous economic counselor Tanuma Okitsugu, who in real life was responsible for major economic reforms in Japan during the Tenmei era. The player takes the role of Tanuma, with orders from shogun Tokugawa Ieharu to revitalize the capital of Edo and build reserves of six million ryō. The player's primary interaction is managing economic factors such as taxes, budgets, and investments, including public works projects and even international trade. Scientific and cultural advancements also play a major part in progression, with the city visibly changing and developing in real-time as the economy grows.
title: Ōedo Renaissance

description: This limited-edition release of Photo Genic includes the game along with a mousepad and a set of dress-up character standees.
title: Photo Genic (Genteiban)
